text: I've never had a bad experience at this place, and I've been coming here for over 10 years now. As you've already read, the pizza muffins are AWESOME and the calzones are huge. Great atmosphere and great prices. Also have a small bar if you're trying to catch the game.

Our family has been going here for years!  Kids love the calzones.  They taste great and they are HUGE!  I love the Pizza Muffins.  Great family atmosphere and the service has always been very good.  Great food at affordable prices!

Floridino's is one of my go-to places in Chandler. I've always received quick and friendly service, and their prices are great. I took one star off of my review because their sandwiches aren't very good, but that won't stop me from coming back and ordering other items off of the menu. Their breadsticks are a must-have!

I was starving and I'd never been there before, so I thought I'd try it out. I ordered the Greek salad with chicken and my mom ordered the Steak sandwich. We waited about 15 minutes for the food and when it came, it looked.... Unappetizing. But wait... The taste was....even worse. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing, I don't know. I've never had such awful food before. The chicken in my salad was obviously microwaved breaded leftover chicken. My mom said her sandwich was like a overly salted frozen steak-um sand which. It was worse than bad fast food. I told the waitress, who was the only redeeming quality in this place, and she said she could take it off our check or bring something else. She was really nice, but by then my appetite was lost and I was scared to try anything else. She told the owner, who came to the table, and I explained that the food was awful. He said there must be something wrong with me, because he's been in business for 9 years. Yes, there must be something wrong with me because I like quality food. I really don't know they stay in business when the owner is so rude and their food sucks....  The only good thing about this place was the wait help (I forgot her name, the young lady with dark hair) and their kid's menu chicken Parmesan was decent.  SIDENOTE:  After leaving this review mistakenly under the Floridino's in Chandler, the owner of the Floridino's in Chandler left me a message informing me that they ARE NOT the same. The Floridino's in Gilbert has a different owner/management and they refuse to change their name.  Sorry about that Floridino's in Chandler. I wouldn't want to be affiliated with them either...

i love that they have the buffalo sauce option for pizza. My favorite it the veggie pizza with buffalo sauce, although my husband is addicted to the pizza muffins. We just recently tried the white pizza muffins and WOW. They are filled with cheeses and garlic sauce. Since we only order pizza there, that's how I'm rating them. The reason I mention this is because we tried their pasta options once and it was severely disappointing (as in, tasted like pasta from a can). But that's not why we order from them. GET THE PIZZA!
Pizza was pretty good, I wish the crust had more "chew" to it. Toppings were very lite. They use sausage balls, I assumed being an Italian restaurant the sausage would be homemade.

I've been here a few times and its just ok for me.  My mom calls this joint "the white head place" because its chock full of seniors. But if you qualify for the senior discount and you have your coupon for buy one get one that is pretty awesome. Adjust expectations to just ok and you will not be disappointed. The service is good, its clean, the food comes relatively quickly. I'll continue to come here.

Had a working lunch at work where pizza muffins were served.  I wasn't really hungry but tried them out...WOW!  Freaking home run.  I'll pick these over traditional pizza from now on.  Can't wait to take my family here.
I love this place. Always fairly busy. I can't resist the pizza muffins, and now they have a few new types I need to try.Usually get pizza , so I can't vouch for much else. Very nice non chain place.
The wait line is really long so be prepared but the food is excellent and the pizza muffins are excellent. Also service is great
I miss your pizza muffins and I miss your calzone's.  Great place to slip in to watch the game.  I miss you.

Yummy! I was pleasantly surprised by the quality in the pizza they make here! I ordered a large with fresh basil, onions, garlic and olives! What a combination! I would definitely recommend this place if you want to get away from main stream and try a little homemade!

It was our first time at Floridino's. We had excellent service. Our waiter was a tall older man. He was very knowledgable, kind, and helpful. The Alfredo sauce was excellent, although it was a very small portion on a large plate. The salad was small, not cold, and cost extra. The spaghetti with meat sauce entree was good but came out looking like a child size portion. Our bill came to $41.00 ( plus a tip of $10.00) and no beverages. We went home and were still hungry because of the small sized portions served. Not really worth $51.00 !! We we not be back or recommend.

Pretty good, not bad... Service was good, fast and friendly. We had the pepperoni pizza muffins, which tasted pretty good but I wish it had a little more filling. The meatball parmigiana sandwich was good too, great meatball. Normally wouldn't mention Caesar salad, as it's pretty standard wherever you have it, but I thought the croutons just tasted great, nice seasoning and a good crunch on them. Also had the bread pudding, which was good as long as you ate each mouthful with the ice cream, but we didn't finish it because there wasn't much ice cream on it. The lunch specials look like a good value, will definitely come back and give this restaurant another go.

I had heard quite a bit about this place so went to try. Even on Tuesday night it was packed, that gave me hope that food is really good. But when we ordered the food, I was disappointed. Appetizers - muffin pizza was delivered after the main course was served. Pasta Alfredo was ok, not at all something to die for compared to few other chain restaurants or even other mom and pop restaurants. They charge extra to add salad and bread which was odd as all other restaurants for the same price of approx $14 will include salad and bread.
Great service. Food was pretty good. Love the crust on the pizza. Dessert was also delicious. Table shared a cookie sundae & it was very sugary sweet but we enjoyed it.
Tasty pizza- lunch size 7" pizza and a drink was only $4.25.  Service was extremely efficient- great for lunchtime.  Very busy om a Friday afternoon.  You can add a small salad for only $1.50.

Went here for lunch at 11:45. Was on a wait list for about 7 minutes. We got a seat and ordered off of the lunch menu. Very well priced and food was excellent. I also ordered a half dozen of the pizza muffins. AWESOME!  Great local restaurant for Italian food. Highly recommend this place.
Ate the Deluxe Calzone and it was delicious, not to mention big. Prices are very reasonable. I plan to go back.

The Floridino's on Alma School is not connected to this restaurant in any way.  The owners of Floridino's in Chandler opened this location back in 2000, but they sold it over ten years ago, and it has sold a few times since then.  The food and menu are different, and the current owners have NEVER trained as a franchise or paid for a franchise, and unfortunately the Chandler Floridino's ends up looking like they are the same company, because the owner in Gilbert is using the name due to a technical loop hole in the paperwork, but it is not only shady business practice to do this, it also hurts the reputation of the owners of the Chandler location who have worked for over 15 years to build their business to the success it is.

Try the pizza muffins.  They were awesome.  Other than that, I can't say much else about the restaurant.  It is very low key and has a lot of customers from the neighborhood.  This is a good place to knock down a few beers and grab some snacks (i.e. pizza muffins) after work.

You can't beat this restaurant for a place to take the family - great atmosphere, great food, and great price.  The wife and I go here every couple of weeks.  Only problem we have found is it seems like more and more people are discoving how great this place is so it can get kind of busy.   HIGHLY recommend.

The name is no longer Floridino's and don't confuse this place, now called Floridema's with the better restaurant in Chandler. Prices are too high for the quality of the food and service is mediocre at best. They should change the sign on the front of the building. This is not Floridino's!
It's a small place, kinda crowded, but not in a bad way. Best calzones in town! Service is usually good and the prices are very reasonable.

I have been to Floridino's many times and have loved every experience! It's a small family restaurant great for everyone. The location is a little far for me but definitely worth the drive. The atmosphere is wonderful and makes you feel at home. Customers always look satisfied to me and happy. Very kid friendly, but also has a bar and sports shown on T.V for adults. Prices are very reasonable, not expensive for how delicious the food is.         The service is great every time. Employees are always very welcoming and servers are quick with drinks and food. The only thing is that they can be very busy on weekends. Each time that I have been, I have been seated fairly quickly for a party of two. However, for larger parties, I could imagine waiting a bit longer. But I can say, it would definitely be worth a small wait! Servers are always very nice, patient, and helpful. Whenever I finish a drink they are always quick to get a refill. And they always make sure that you have everything you need, which is great.     Finally, food! I have only ordered their pizza muffins, because I just fell in love with them the first time, and have never wanted to get anything else! They are absolutely amazing. I have tried three of their flavors and love them all. Definitely a great food to share with other people. I am always so full after eating and always satisfied. They also have the best dessert! Their baked cookie and cannoli are so good. Both very sweet and savory. If you have never been to Floridino's I highly recommend that you try it out! You won't be disappointed.

The food here was really bland, I'm not sure why there are so many good reviews... And yes, we tried the pizza muffins! Maybe I was expecting a real Italian restaurant but it was extremely casual. For example, the salad is iceberg and the dressing comes in a to-go container with a lid, and they use the red plastic baskets for everything.  Not what I had in mind! I wouldn't recommend going here if you're looking for great pasta!
Real good italian food. Their lunch specials are such a great deal and you can't go wrong with any of them. I especially love the complementary bread they give you with your meal.
Visiting from Houston Texas was recommended here. Really good food!!! I fell in love with the pizza definitely returning

Simple, excellent food with awesome service. Not only is the food good, but they are the example of what businesses should do to give back to the community that supports them. They do multiple fundraisers throughout the year for area schools and non-profit organizations. Large events are a must do here, cant beat the prices for banquet style events. Great job Floridino's!!!!
Best chicken Alfredo ever!! Love the creamy sauce and the delicious soft bread that comes with it! Their pizza is also great! Love love this place :)

After reading the reviews on Yelp, I decided to try this place last night. I placed a to-go order and when I got there to pick it up I was pleasantly surprised by how busy it was and how much it smelled like the little places we used to eat in Chicago.   The good-  The hostess person who rung me up was extremely friendly and checked inside all my boxes before putting them in bags, to make sure my order was correct. I can't tell you how much I appreciate that.  The delux steak sandwich was the BOMB. The steak was tender and plentiful and the veggies were just right. The pasta salad is phenomenal. It doesn't seem to be much more than pasta, dressing, and cucumbers but it is DEEEElish.  The pizza muffins~ Very good and not was I was expecting, although next time I will skip the sausage and ham combo and make my own. The dude ahead of my got bacon, onions and ground beef and I was wicked jealous.   The Meh-  We ordered a kid's spaghetti, which was pretty straightforward. The portions seemed a bit small as another poster mentioned. Although I did not actually see a regular sized order of spaghetti, the kids meal was kinda meager. Although if you go on Wednesday when kids eat free, you couldn't complain. Incidentally, someone also said it is busy on Wednesdays because of this... Thursday was packed so I can't imagine what it would be like when free food is involved.   The bad-  Meatball sub was a huge letdown. Meatballs were just little frozen generic subway-esque disappointments.  The portions. That pasta salad was to die for but I only got a couple of bites of it, which made me sad.   Overall, we're down to give this place another try. We definitely wanna try the pizza and antipasta.

Eh...  The person who took our to go order was nice, and it's decent priced...for that a 3  But my sauce on my raviolis was just bland maybe out a can with no seasoning, I paid extra for meatballs and got two small ones. I'm guessing my pasta was put in bowl then sauce over cuz they were all stuck together.  Not great but not bad, but I feel like I'd put more Italian effort into then them and I'm German.
Ok food and price but not real Italian food, if you are looking for arthritic food, don't let the name fool you

We hosted a bridal shower here and everyone was a pleasure to work with.  We had the option to choose from several different tablescapes and they executed it perfectly!  The food was delicious and I didn't have to worry about anything.  Do not hesitate to hold your event here!!!
Always great food and service. Kids eat free on Wednesdays too which was a nice surprise.  Been coming here for years, never disappointed.
I've been going here for a decade. The spicy chicken pizza & the pizookie can't be beat!

The first time I had their food was when my boyfriend picked up a to-go order for us. He ordered the pizza muffins,a Cesar salad for myself and an Italian sandwich for him. LOVED every part of the food my salad was fresh and tasty. They make their own sauces come to find out, their salad dressing and marinara sauce are superb.
First time dining here and it was ok.  The ziti was decent and my friend said the lasagna was decent as well. Unsure if I will go back.

The cheese and the pepperoni on my mini pizza glisten, taunting me to dive in. I scarf down my pizza in a matter of minutes and rub my belly, thinking, 'I'll have to do a few more crunches tonight but it was well worth it.'  This is the usual battle I have when I go to Chandler's Floridino's for lunch with the gang where it's always a struggle to avoid the calzone, which is seriously the best calzone I've ever had in my life.    Floridino's is one of my favorite lunchtime destinations because the service is good and the pizza is dyn-O-mite. And you can get a  mini pizza and a drink for under $5 during lunch time. Lunch doesn't get any better than this.

Love the food and value! Portions are reasonable for the reasonable price. Food quality is very good.   This is the second time Dustin was our server. He detracts from the awesomeness of the food and restaurant. Both times, he will take the order and disappear or stands by the POS station. The other servers came by and filled drinks. This time we had to walk to the kitchen window to get a an entree corrected (served with marinara instead of meat sauce). He dropped off the bill. We had to hold up the payment folder w card to get him to take it. If I get him again, I won't come back. So sad.

I really like their food. I recommend the calzones and the pizza bagels. Pretty good price for one person and its very filling.  I would have given this four stars but the service is kind of iffy. Sometimes the service is really good and sometimes it's eh.
I heard good things about this place. We picked it up for dinner one night. I had meat raviolis. Tasted just like Chef Boy r D from a can. Yuck.
Pizza muffins are amazing. We also like lasagna and and anti pasta salad. They also gave pazookis!

The patrons here look like they are all on the same bowling league. Now before you think I'm being snotty, there's something very comforting about a blue collar, good food, family restaurant.  I've had the baked spaghetti and it's delicious. The wine selection isn't very good, but they serve cold beer.  I would recommend this place for a lazy week night dinner.

Where has this place been my whole life, or least in my lifetime of using UberEATS?! It has been by far the best food I've ordered. I will admit, that they got my order slight wrong, but it was a blessing in disguise because the chicken alfredo was delicious. But what was even better were the buffalo chicken muffins. Fear not, they aren't as spicy as the description may seem. The portion was enough for me to eat three meals throughout the week and it heated up just as good as day one. I will definitely be eating here again.
Hot yummy and friendly staff!  Always a great neighborhood eatery for a great price.
Restaurants like this ladies and gents are why you don't need to be married! Great job folks!!

So...since I first ate fresh brick oven mushroom and onion pizza with my Daddy in a little dive on Peachtree St. in Atlanta in 1972, I have had this thing for pizza.  (Yes, I had eaten it also at the only Italian restaurant in our area - Gargano's - it was good, but not like that one!!!) I love it.  No other way to put it.  So, when we find a place we like, we don't want to change.  Well...we had our favorite NY style pizza in the town we left in Cali last year - Rocky's - and had no hopes of finding a place with the same home-town, delicious vibe.  BUT, we did!!  At FloriDino's in Gilbert.  We come back here at least once a month, and I even tried lunch  - good deal, too.  I'll just break it down quickly:  1. The prices are quite reasonable, especially considering....(keep reading...) 2. The portions are incredible.  We share...everything! 3.  Pizza Muffins were invented by a genius and man, oh, man - they are good fresh,        leftover, 5 days old...whenever. 4.  The bread sticks/cheese sticks are quite yummy. 5.  The calzones are ginormous and delicious beyond the imagination - especially       the White Calzones.  Oh heavens!! 6.  The pizzas are excellent - any way you like them. 7.  They make a decent Caesar - big enough to share. 8.  Tiramisu was huge and delicious and the cheesecake was good, too. 9.  The service is great, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere       congenial. 10.  Family style seating, bar seating, cozy booths and table seating. 11.  ENJOY!!!
Yum!  Hidden Gem!  Service is fabulous, the pizza is best I've had in a long time! Baked spagetti will put you over the edge!

This a review for the location on Guadalupe and Baseline.  It doesn't seem to be on Yelp.  Anyway YUM!  The second we walked in my mouth watered it smelled so good.  We were sat down immediately and the service was great.  The salad was eh but edible.  The pizza muffins were divine!  We ordered six and they brought 8 which is always fun.  We devoured them with the yummy Bruschetta type sauce that came with it.  In addition we got cheese ravioli with meat sauce and chicken fettuccini alfredo and breadsticks.  The breadsticks were good though a little dry for my taste.  But in general  YUM YUM YUM!!!  The best Italian I have had in the Gilbert/Mesa/Chandler/Tempe/Awatukee area by far!

Been here about five or six times.  OK food. OK service. No Italian beers on tap and not that many in the bottle.    OK atmosphere.  Just wish they would replace the worn out padding in the booths. Wouldn't hurt to adjust the booth lighting so you didn't feel like you were the guest of honor at a KGB interrogation.    My wife loves that giant cookie and ice cream dessert thing.  It's an old stand by kind of place that you can count on for a good meal with decent service.  They do a good business here and are busy everytime I drive by.

I had never been to floridinos before booking my grad party with them.  I went off yelp reviews, price,  and location.  It was amazing!  The food pleased even the pickiest of Italians (not exactly traditional, but delicious nonetheless)and was priced great.  Lindsay,  the banquet coordinator was helpful and gave great guidance (the baked spaghetti is not to be missed). Even though almost everyone came,  we were still left with a ton of left over food,  which the server helped us pack up.  I can't wait to come back and sample some other things!  My favorites were the baked spaghetti and pizza muffins! Thank you again for great food and service!
Just visited again last night. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! Greatest calzones ever. Yum, yum, yum.

I was in the mood for some pizza, so I yelped it and found this place about a half mile from my house. I just moved in and have been looking for a place in the neighborhood that I could frequent and not have to spend too much.Pretty sure this is the place for me.  The pizza muffins are awesome.  I also got the steak sandwich, which was delicious. My wife had the veggie lasagne, which she liked. I thought it was just ok, but I can't say I'm at huge fan of veggie lasagne in the first place. The salad was pretty basic, but I don't go to restaurants for salad. All in all we were both happy with what we ordered.   The service was great, especially considering how busy it was. We went on Monday night, which is senior night. If you're over 55, it's buy one get one. I think every old timer in the entire city of chandler showed up. But we only had to wait about 5 minutes to get a table, and got our food about 15 minutes after we sat down.  If you're in the mood for simple but tasty food without a bunch of fluff, hit this place up.

The margherita pizza was delish!! My friend had the pizza muffins with jalapenos, YUM!  Nice family place but we went with friends and stayed for two hours, didn't feel rushed at all.  I will definitely eat there again!

Every meal that I have had from this restaurant has been fantastic. However, it is no exaggeration to say that I'm absolutely addicted to the pepperoni pizza muffins! I would eat them over pizza any day from any restaurant. Although it does make me sad, it probably is a good thing for my waistline that I now live on the west side of town!
As everyone else said the calzones are great!  Gets busy during lunch, but they seem to be used to it.  $7 for a calzone and a drink is a great price too.

This is, as far as I'm aware, THE casual Italian place in Chandler. There's been more than one occasion where myself and a group of friends can't decide what to eat, and have gone here by default. We all get calzones (which are a bit greasy, my only complaint), which are always huge and hot. There are plenty of choice for the stuffing, so everyone gets something they like. They've just expanded to add a new dining area, which was good since before we'd occasionally have to wait (gasp!) for a few minutes to seated. So no, don't go here if you want fine wine and fancy Italian dining. But do go here otherwise.

Stopped into Floridino's for lunch with 3 other friends today. I've been here a few times in the past, and today I wanted to try something other than the pasta. We were put on the list for a 20 minute wait, which I thought was reasonable, as the place seemed pretty packed for lunch. No biggie.  Got our seats easily within the quoted time, and sat down and ordered a round. We got our beers very quickly, and also were brought waters without asking, which was nice. Our waiter did not seem like he brought his "A" game, or even his "B" game today, as placing our order seemed forced and uncomfortable. We waited about 15 minutes for our food, which I think was pretty normal, as there were three calzones, and one sandwich. The food was fantastic, and when we asked for more marinara, the waiter brought us some right away.  When the check came, the waiter simply dropped off what looked like the check and immediately left. About 5 minutes later he came back and we asked for him to split the check. He took the check over to the bartender, and had the bartender split it, which I thought was rather strange, and looked very upset about having to split the check. Another 5 minutes, and we got the separate checks back. I got up to get my own box while waiting for the checks because who knows how much longer it would have been.  Food - Fantastic. The calzone was amazing. And more than I could finish. Price - Very reasonable. With tip it was $12 for a calzone and a beer. Service - Bad. It seemed as though either the waiter hadn't waited tables before, or just really hated us for showing up.   I'm giving two stars based on service. I could easily see giving 4 stars with a good waiter.

The garlic knots are a must. The calzones are the best I've had. There is just something about the cheese that makes you not want to stop. And the baked lasagna is superb. The price is right and I have enough leftovers to last me another 2 servings. The service is okay, but everything else makes up for it.

I've been here a few times, and the pizza is superb! Crispy, flavorful, and savory. Pure heaven. I've also always had really attentive and courteous customer service. It's nice that they have the banquet hall for larger groups...each time I've been, it's with about 20+ other people. The restaurant is super accommodating!

First and foremost the food was good and the wait staff friendly. This was my first time here so I went with a couple of menu items that received raves on Yelp, the pizza muffins and pizza.   I was a little disappointed in the pizza muffins, maybe because of all the hype I was expecting something that could not be achieved by a pizza muffin. It was good, but not a must have good. You might want to order these for small children as their dinner, or order them before you leave so you could pack them in the kids lunch for school.   The pizza, a large special, was one of the better pizzas that I have had. It actual had dimension; one might say layers of flavor. This will be one of the pizzas that I will start ordering instead of delivery because the place is so close.  The restaurant was casual and very open and was just a little too loud for my liking. It was very busy when I went at 7pm on a Sunday. Take a suggestion from me, and use the takeout.

We read the great reviews on Floridino's and so we decided to give it a try. Well, wasted money and calories!  Worst pizza ever!  No flavor at all.  A frozen pizza would have been better!  I'm only giving it a star because it forces me to!

Hands down this is the best value for Italian food in the East Valley. went to dinner with the family last night and enjoyed their homemade pizza muffins in a variety both flavors including barbecue chicken and pepperoni and sausage. the wait staff is extremely friendly and spend time making sure that your experience is a good one! everything on the menu is delicious and I will be returning often! I highly recommend floridino's to anyone looking for that Mom and Pop experience at a great price.

Been eating here for years. I would eat there after getting out of Erie school. My parents took me there now I take my kids. Always good hot tasty food . great salad and calzones. Will visit again and again. Keep up the good work.

I ordered takeout of lasagne and chicken parm.  The lasagne was ok, the chicken parm tasted previously frozen and the side pasta like Chef Boy R D.  Would try the pizza or calzone next time but not a fan of the dinners.

I thought I had a find, but look at all the prior reviews!   I just don't understand why they aren't all fives.   Maybe because this is a family style place and not a yelpie-yuppie date night joint.  I live too far away to visit regularly and have only been the once.  The wife, kids and grandkids all loved our varied orders and the pizza is outstanding with a just-right hint of yeast.  If gas prices ever come down again I will be making special trips to this place.

Used to come here all the time and was amazing. Tonight was not super great.  Got chicken parmigiana and it was a chew frozen chicken patty. Also got the chicken primavera and it was good but not amazing. Also realized after we paid that we got charged almost $5 extra for one of our meals.  On a plus their bread sticks are amazing but not described very well. I bet the pizzas and calzones would be amazing if they are made with the same bread.  Our server was super nice and very good. Just wish the food was better.  Would recommend sitting outside as their AC is not working very well.
I had a HUGE Meat Calzone with a Coke. Price was reasonable.

Great place for lunch.  I've been going here at least once a month since 1998.  Often it has been a weekly lunch spot.  During that time I almost always ordered the 2 item calzone which is big and a great deal with drink.  Occasionally I order some pizza rolls if I am not as hungry.   They are also excellent. They often have big crowds especially on Thursday or Friday at 12 so get there a little earlier to beat the rush.  They usually have a large crew working and the servers are quick and efficient so even if there is a little bit of a wait, it's worth it and it won't be long.  I guess it's been a while now since they expanded their square footage which helps with those busy days.  I can't understand how anyone can criticize the decor??  WTF?  Maybe those people actually enjoy all the crap on the wall at a TGIF's.  I go there for the food.

Floridino's is a great place to go for authentic Italian food. I love love the pizza muffin. It's so tasty and super reasonable with the price. I am also a big fan of their Antipasto salad. So glad to have a local, authentic restaurant in the neighborhood.

They were incredibly accommodating and the food/service was awesome. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious pizza around downtown chandler. The pizza muffins were my favorite.  The staff was super friendly!
This is a great little spot. Great food, good prices, and no bullshit service. Pizza muffins are my favorite. Keep it up guys. Go in early,n place gets packed
Pizza muffins are what brings us here.  They are awesome.  Good salads and great service as well.  Atmosphere is cozy and relaxed.  Good for families.

This place is like a time warp. You know in E.T. when they go out, how dated and weirdly old timey everything looks? That's how this place looks. Certainly not a place to go when you have to impress someone, as it is clearly meant to be a comfy family-style restaurant.   But I am a family style kind of gal so this place was right up my alley. The food is tasty, plentiful and affordable. We had the greek salad, large pizza with green peppers, and manicotti with meat sauce. The greek salad was your standard greek salad, kind of overpriced for how much you got and I would likely pass on salad next time. The pizza was huge and delicious though, and I was pleasantly surprised to see that instead of little strips of green bell pepper, they finely diced the peppers so you get pepper in every bite. A slightly floppy, awesome NY style pizza. The manicotti was very rich and heavy and far too much for one person to eat on their own - I should have known better, considering it was stuffed to the gills with an awesome cheese mixture. The meat sauce was flavorful and had a bright tomato and fennel taste.   Service is fast and efficient (though leaning on the perfunctory side). The restaurant is clean with a dive-y kind of atmosphere, but I wouldn't have it any other way. You really get the feeling that you are in a well-loved neighborhood spot.
Yummy Italian. Inexpensive.  Not too much seating though. Pizza rolls & calzones are awesome!! Would be a great place for lunch too!!
The pizza muffins and pizzookie were real good. Service was on par for a busy night. I'd come back again if I'm in the area. There should be one in Phoenix!!
Good spot to eat and was not too loud. Service was good as well. My cousin got a fettuccine alfredo and I got their pizza muffins. The prices were affordable as well.

My favorite thing to get here is their spicy chicken pizza muffins! Wow!!! I have been addicted for the past 8 years and has never been disappointed! We have taken all of our friends and now they are addicted! Great customer service!!   Their side of bread or side salad is not the greatest or their water but their pizza muffins will change your life with marinara and their home made ranch on the side!

Worst service I've experienced in a long time. I sat for 40 minutes without a server coming over to ask what I wanted to order, and then I asked for a manager. A blonde/redhead named Sarah came over and gave me the biggest attitude. She kept saying "I don't know what you want me to do" and did nothing to resolve the situation. I left without being helped by anyone. Completely disappointed since this was my first time coming here, and I didn't get to try anything. Don't come here if you can help it.
LAME, I came for an internet special and even after showing it to my server did not honor it due to the fact that no manger was available. BAD REVIEWS ARE A BITCH!

nice local italian. great people. real food. great quality, reasonable prices. no negatives at all... I go a few times a week and have never been disappointed. I would recommend this resturuant to anyone...Dema, the owner, is always there to welcome you. servers are attentive, professional and knowledgeable

The boyfriend and I wanted pizza for dinner, and a quick Yelp search showed a highly-rated pizza place practically across the street...there wasn't even a second thought.  And we were not disappointed!    We had a margherita pizza and coke, and got out of there full and happy for less than $15.  Service was good; they weren't very busy and the server was attentive and available.  The restaurant had a good "pizza joint" vibe.  The banquet room off to the side looks like it would be a great area for large groups or parties.    There was a lot more on the menu I'd like to try, everything looked great.  Definitely going back!

They have my kind of casual service.  Never overly happy- in your face- bombarding service.  Your waiter asks if you're doing OK a couple of times and if you need anything after that, you just tell them. It's a small place, so they will always be near by. I always enjoy this honest to goodness Italian food.  I've had the eggplant, the fettuccine Alfredo, calzone and the Sicilian cookie dessert . . .all amazing!

First-timers: Get the two-item calzone, and arrive at the restaurant as close to opening as you can if you want to get a table with no wait.  To expand on that, the calzones here are huge and perfect. The outside of the calzone, instead of being an obstacle to get to the filling, is delicious in its own right. The filling choices are pretty extensive and include more unusual items like salami and spaghetti.  If you are a returning customer or just have a bigger appetite than most, try the pizza muffins appetizer. This can work as a meal or appetizer, depending on the group size. 12 for $5 is an amazing deal. These have meat, cheese, sauce, and bread in every bite, and they are simply fantastic.  Everything I have tried at Floridino's is great. The bartender and servers are friendly and give that extra something that makes the customers feel special.
Service, awesome.   Food, great.  Tried the special.   Great pizza.  Thin type crust, good sauce, and affordable for a large.  Parking is great.  Fast seating.  Just do it!
My family loves to go here on Monday or Tuesday, which is family night there. Pizza muffins are awesome!  W have been eating here for the past couple of years.

We came to the restaurant after a Sorority meeting - with a pretty large group....15.   Castaneda was the waitress and handle our table plus one other large party of 7 and was amazing never skipped a beat.   I had a pizza which was great but other guests had calzones, lasagna, pasta and everyone enjoyed each bite of their food....I probably wouldn't have ever picked this restaurant driving by but if I am ever in the area again I would definitely come back and bring a friend!
Food and service is always good.   I have never been disappointed.  We love their pizza muffins and  calzones.  Also their antipasto salad.

This isn't just a Yelp review, it's a love letter. We went to the Phoenix Bridal Show last month, and Floridino's was one of the vendors. There were quite a few food samples, but their samples stood out. The fettuccine Alfredo was the best I've ever tasted, hands down. And the lasagna was loaded with beefy goodness. We had been sharing samples, but I actually grabbed my own separate samples.  We drive 40 min, one way, to try the food tonight. This restaurant isn't fancy, but when your food is this good who cares?!?!!! We asked friends to join us, but weren't sure how many would be coming. I didn't make a reservation. The wait staff was very accommodating. In fact, there was several tables available to accommodate large parties at any time.   For a Sunday, the restaurant was packed! It must be a popular choice for Sunday dinner. We ordered the pizza muffins and they didn't take very long to come out.  They were a little bit smaller than I had imagined, but chock full of flavor. The lasagna was just as meaty as the sample we had at the bridal show. I had the pasta primavera-the sauce was just divine. We also shared a cannoli, and it was just perfect.   Btw, why are you still reading this? You should be at Floridino's right now. Just go already! We're planning a wedding vow renewal and will be contacting Floridino's to be the caterer. This was the first but definitely not the last time we'll be eating here.

Because of my Chinese background, I've had a lack of some serious food initiations... ie.  I never tasted a Pop-Tart til college, and I never had pizza rolls until here.  This is one of those restaurants the local neighborhood likes to eat at, and if you aren't a local, you'd only swing by b/c there is something you extremely like.  We are definitely the latter and this is our order for 2 people:    1.  Pizza rolls (comes w/ ham & sausage... a sliced up calzone w/ less chesse) 2.  Antipasto Salad 3.  More pizza rolls for taking home ...

It was the first time I've been here and the service was outstanding, the food was AMAZING and tasty, the atmosphere was nice, but... You walk out hungry! The portions are ridiculously small and the price for it is not descent at all it's pricy for the size they give you. Someone needs to notify them to make there portions a bit bigger. The next dinner I had the next day was McDonald's and that was 3 times as more filling then this. That day I went to floridinos I went hungry so I had to stop at another restaurant to fill me and my family up. We won't be coming back there.

I went here on 4th of July on their $4 pizza muffins deal.  We were seated within 15 min on 4th of July, granted it was 2 PM. I was pleased with the wait time. we ordered the pepperoni and combo pizza muffins for $4 per dozen along with a large antipasto salad to share.  The salad was very wet and drenched in sauce, but it was very tasty and tangy, and the pizza muffins were soft and doughy. I enjoyed all the items and the price of the items bumped them from 3 to 4 stars. I would come back again for good and inexpensive Italian food.

Simply fantastic. The only problem I have ever had coming here was that I never want to get anything new. My usual is always so good and consistent that I can't stray away. I've had samples off friends plates and it's always great.   I have always had the BBQ chicken muffins. If you've never had their pizza muffins, stop whatever you are doing and head straight their now. They're amazing. The other pasta dishes are also very good.   This is a popular family restaurant, so expect to wait for a bit on a weekend evening.

We ordered take-out some original pizza muffins, fettuccine alfredo, and baked manicotti. All were delicious! The alfredo sauce was rich and creamy. The pizza muffins were a hit with my son who normally doesn't like pizza. We will definitely eat here again.

Solid performer in the fast Italian take-out scene.  Can't go wrong with their calzones.  You can already tell if you've read my reviews that I love the combination of spinach and mushrooms so that's what I always ordered in mine!  The tomato sauce and cheese are not overwhelming and the serving is generous.  The ex always got a meat calzone and he said "no" when I suggested Floridino's for dinner.  We may have tried the pizza once, but we decided after that to stick to the calzones.  Service is pretty fast and reliable from what the take-out perspective, which is how we always ordered.  I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I could.  It's good eating, but nothing in the "WOW" category that would grant it 4 stars.

This is a regular for me. If you've had GREAT Italian, this is not that. It's GOOD, it's VERY reasonably priced. The calzones are excellent and I'm not sure you can get a better lunch for a cheaper price almost anywhere. Service is great. They are always busy. Quite frankly the worst thing is that parking spots can be tough if you drive a big truck -- ahem-- but other than that it's great. I love it. I go there once a week, it's like comfort food.
My first time trying this place and I love it! It's inexpensive and delicious! I love the sauce because it is light and not thick and full of pepper like other places. I'll be back for sure!

It was my day off. A breezy 70 degree day and I had a taste for an Italian sandwhich.  I've heard this place has killer lunch specials and to my surprise it had killer customer service too.  For a quick lunch eat quickly became one of the best treated dining experiences.    Mellisa was my waitress. A smiling blue eyed warm person whom made me feel like I was back in my grandfathers italian kitchen chatting with an old friend.    She recommended the chicken parm and I added a cheese slice, I'm from Chicago so I am always curious about a restaurants pizza.  The chicken parm was huge. 10 inch bread stuffed with chicken sauce and cheese. I took half of it home.   The slice was good a cross between New York style and artisan pizza. A great butter crust.    I also had a lemonade which was perfect for our door seating and the patio.     Check em out for lunch. You won't be disappointed in the quality for the price.
Solid, cheap, delicious Italian.  Good calzones, baked spaghetti, and Alfredo (don't forget to add chicken).  Excellent for takeout as well.
Excellent.  Great prices and excellent service.  Loved the chicken park and butternut squash ravioli .

I LOVE Florindino's. Their food is consistently good, especially the pizza muffins! Their ranch is house-made and delicious also. 3 stars instead of 5 because although I have come here many times, I had to stop a few months ago after I couldn't take the grumpy hostess they've had for about the last year.   Still worth coming, just don't let the person seating you turn you off from the rest of the experience!
Can't beat the Monday night specials.  Food was good and price was cheap!  Service was great and definitely will be back.

Went with a group of 11 people and as far as I know all of the food we ordered was spot on!  Of course, we tried the pepperoni muffins and they are pretty freakin good... I ate 3 or 4 .   The reason I took off one star is because the Italian wedding soup I ordered was not hot... At all. I didn't send it back because it was edible and I was hungry. I also noticed the stopped refilling drinks after the check was paid...   Worth going back for the muffins but nothing else I tried (soup, pizza, chicken parm) was worth going back for.
Just went there for dinner again.  What happened?  Pizza was downright lousy.  Crust was awful-sausage not tasty at all.  Completely forgettable.

Always so amazing at this place. The nice servers and the food made with love. Just can't beat the prices and the atmosphere.  Our server Ryan was so kind and helpful. We ordered fettuccine Aioli with chicken, a veggie bowl and baked speghetti with meatballs. Also ordered the house special muffins. Too die for!! Absolutely must go to place when u want Italian food that is deliciouso....

Steady. Good food. Great prices.  I have had many calzones and they have been detrimental to my health.  If I were to choose one to end my life, I'd choose Floridinos.  Not that it's unhealthy, it's just my lifestyle. Don't judge, I like flavor and flavor is not salad.

Second time tonight at Floridino's. It was even better than the first. The original pizza muffins are a must order. They are so good i should have made them my meal. I had the baked spagetti with italian sausage.  The sausage was the star. It was spicy and delicious. My boyfriend had the italian deluxe sandwich served hot. He was very happy.  The service was great. This place gets packed. Be prepared to wait if you get there after 5:30.

This place is very overpriced for what you get. They charge extra for extra sauce...really? A huge calzone with a tiny side of marinara??? I think that's being a little cheap. Will not be returning. It's the things like that are very annoying and make me want to go elsewhere.

Couldn't decide between the Gluten Free Pasta/Pizza( as the pizza was amazing the first time). So ended up getting both. They were both just amazing. The Gluten Free Pizza is the best I have had in the last three years that I have been gluten free!!!  Also wanted to tell you that your staff is amazing. Their customer service is out of this world. The other day my hubby got a pasta and didn't really like it and no questions asked , she apologized and took it off the bill.  Today we sat at the bar and the two bar tenders/servers were just unbelievable. They managed to balance serving all of us at the bar, checking out all the pick up orders, and answering  the phone for pick up orders and questions on wait times... Never did the the smiles leave their face and still gave us some one on one attention. I just wanted to take a few minutes and send you some positive feedback.   We have our new neighborhood place that we will be Frequenting a lot more .
We have been here several times as a short walk from home.  We bring friends and family.  Service is friendly and food is delish.  Outside dining in good weather is a treat.

Biased in my opinion, but the food is excellent.  The go to's for me are pizza muffins, calzones, steak sandwich, baked spaghetti, zesty bread, chicken alfredo and Caesar salad.  Great for a lunch stop, bring the whole family for dinner or have an event in the banquet room.  Great prices, great food!
Love this place. The service and the food is wonderful  Very good value  Everything is delicious  Especially the pizza

So it was my first time trying pizza muffins and this place is my new top pizza place!!! I got their buffalo chicken half dozen muffins. And I thought it might not be enough and I was wrong; it was perfect in every way~ Oh and the price is super super super affordable. I also got their Cicilian Sundae and that was bomb also. My time there was amazing so I would definitely recommend this place.

Most reasonably priced, and delicious Italian food in Chandler. They serve pitchers of beer too! Bonus! Pepperoni Muffins are the bomb. Definitely on my list of places to go out for dinner from now on. Great low key vibe too :)

Let me start off by saying this place is poppin!  Whoa...  I met some friends there on a Friday night at 8pm for dinner and the place was packed!  Next time I'm going to make a reservation for sure!  We all started off by ordering the pizza muffins.  And just as I read on the reviews from other yelpers, they were delicious!  Full of flavor, delivered hot to the table and the marinara sauce was a great addition to the muffins.  They brought out ranch as well, which I thought was a nice touch as most individuals choose to have ranch with their pizza products.  For dinner I ordered a calazone.  It was made well, it was reasonably priced and I topped it with some extra marinara to add a little more saucy flavor to mine.  It was a big portion and I took 1/2 home.  This place will definitely be a place I frequent for some italian food in the neighborhood.  I highly recommend coming by and trying out the food here!

So I have very much disliked any food I have had here. The teachers I teach with really like it though so I end up coming time and again because of them. To me, the flavor of all the entrees is just not very good. Haven't found a meal I like yet.

Not my favorite pizza. Just a little bland to me. The Sicilian cookie on the other hand saved this trip for me. If not, it wouldn't have gotten 4 stars. The service was great and they were really fast. Guess the pizza muffins would have been a better bet. The 6 dollar large on a Sunday though was hard to ignore.

Total fan for life.  My car battery died en route to pick up an order I placed, and it was well after Floridino's closed when AAA completed my roadside assistance. I sped over there to see if they'd still be open so I could at least apologize in person, and lo and behold, my order was still there, AND they remade it since my fiance called to update them what was going on.   Superb service, food was awesome when we finally sat down to eat. We ordered a small side salad (I think they upgraded me, another kudos),  a half dozen pepperoni pizza muffins and a calzone. The pizza rolls were buttery, just enough cheese and a great chew, and the GINORMOUS  calzone was inhaled in 1 sitting by my fiance.   Take it from an angry, pizza lovin' New Yorker, this is yummy stuff with outstanding service. Support your local joints, come visit Floridino's!
Worst Chicken Parm ever (including frozen meals) but very good pizza.  I give it 2 stars. If you are an Italian place it is not acceptable to have terrible Chicken Parm...Sorry

The pizza muffins have been our "go to" here but last night we decided to change it up a bit and order the family bucket of fettuccine chicken Alfredo based on Jenny Y's testimony. Oh boy was it insanely delicious ! Probably the best I've ever had. We ordered the size that feeds 4-6 and it fed 4 very hungry teenage boys and 2 adults...AND we have plenty of leftovers. A great deal, for $39 you get enough pasta, garlic bread and salad to feed a family, and then some ;) Highly recommend!

This is one of my favorite Italian places! The prices are right, the food is oh so good, and the service is great!  I usually order the pizza muffins as an appetizer and get a white pizza calzone... yum!  If there is room leftover the desserts are fun too!
We had pizza here last night and it was awesome. Taste great less filling, lol, great customer service, fast pizza turn around time, friendly staff, Reasonable price, good quantity

Very good local restaurant. It is smaller and very busy so on Fridays and Saturdays you need to get there early to get a seat for dinner hours. It is worth the wait.   Excellent food and great service
Yummy pizza! Their portions are a bit small for the price, but it usually tastes pretty good. Can't wait to try their breakfast menu soon!

Let me tell you.... I am from a part of California where I grew up with a lot of friends with deep Italian roots(food to be specific)... they take pride in their home cooked meals, and as a child I was the beneficiary of enjoying those authentic Italian meals. I've never loved food more than Italian. I've lived in Arizona for years and this place takes me back to that place as a child. This restaurant is amazing and what I love the most is your staff. All smiles and they make me feel at home. Thank you, Florindinos, you are truly amazing
Amazing food! Get the pizza muffins if you go! Also great place to have a party, I had my 16th birthday party at Floridino's and it was great! Great food and service!

This is not my first review of Floridino's.  I was very close to never eating here again after being served "understuffed" calzones 3x in a row.  The outside corners contained nothing the last three times I dined there.  The saving grace for this restaurant is the Pizza Muffins.  They are excellent.  The pizzas are really good as well.  I'll stick with one of those two when I go there.  My daughters love this place, so I can't avoid going there.  I gave an extra star just because my kids love their food.  Step your game up, Floridino's!  Do some quality control with your calzones!
Ordered the calzone lunch special. Wow! It was big! It even came with a soda with free refills.  Crispy crust and just the right amount of cheeses and sauce. Yum! Definitely a good deal.

This is my place for great thin crust NY style pizza. Fast, cheap and super yummy. My whole family loves this place. We usualy get a cheese pie and a sausage pie. Both are 18'' $13 for the cheese pie and an extra two dollars for the extra topping. We get our pizza here every Friday.
Nice people, nice atmosphere, nice food. Would recommend to anyone working in the area and looking for a good lunch spot. They were quick to take our order and brought out the food promptly

I was in town for business and wanted a pizza/pasta type of establishment for lunch.  I found this place via yelp and it was a great success.  I had the primavera alfredo and a small pizza (personal size).  Both were just what I was looking for.  Very family-friendly, casual.  Service was very good, and they were busy on a Friday lunch crowd.  I would definitely recommend this place.
Great service. Great food. Calzones are huge and delicious. Pizza muffins are a must! We will definitely be coming back.
Great food and great service. I eat their pizza muffins on a weekly basis. They are great when served with their ranch sauce. Yum

So many have raved about the food however I just don't see it!  I did not order the pizza which was the item that I was told to order.  Sorry, was not in the mood.  If your pizza is that good the rest of your menu items should be the same.  I ordered the eggplant and chicken parm.  Smalllll portions that was in no way homemade. The side of meatballs (that they charge an extra $2.00)  were out of frozen bag bag of mini meatballs that you can get in any freezer section!!!!! Even the "muffins" were so, so.  Olive Garden (really not a fan of) puts them to same!
We eat here often! Amazing large calzones! The crust is fantastic and is so good!  Great place with great service!

I'm really not sure what the fuss is all about. We probably made the mistake of getting the margherita pizza which was pretty much cheese pizza with tomato slices and a little chopped basil. I expected slices of mozzarella and full leaves of basil. The breadsticks were bland and disappointing. My husband said papa johns is better and he hates papa johns. Even the bread pudding was just okay nothing special.

The pasta sauce could not be more bland. Nothing special at all about this place. Our service was slow. The table we were at was in really rough shape. Have no idea why people think it's good. If you like Spaghetti O's you'll enjoy it.

Floridino's has many good attributes, including their service, their location, and their innovative dishes. The servers engage us and show real interest without sacrificing speed or quality. Floridino's is located in a low traffic strip mall so there is plenty of extra parking spots for when they are crowded. I have never experienced a time where I drove around searching for a parking spot. I simply pull into the lot and can find a parking space that is widely available. Floridino's has two delicious and unique dishes: calzone and pizza muffins. The first are the Pizza Muffins, an appetizer better described as pizza rolls. Bits of sausage, ham and cheese are rolled up in fresh-baked pizza dough and paired with a side of pizza sauce. The other must-have menu item is the calzone, which ranks among the best, and probably biggest, in the entire Valley. Out of any venue in Arizona, I believe Floridino's does an excellent job at being a one of a kind, Mom and Pop's restaurant.

Really disappointed in my decision to come here instead of going to the Floridino's in Chandler. I learned only after that the two locations are not affiliated in any way, however they have some of the same menu items. I have always gotten the pizza muffins. I've only tried a couple of other things from the menu but keep coming back to the muffins because they're so damn good. Needless to say, this location completely fails at the pizza muffins. I ordered two dozen ham & mushroom for myself and my boyfriend and every single muffin was primarily pizza dough...hardly any toppings. My friends also ordered the original pizza muffins and complained that there was hardly any toppings on theirs. They're also more expensive at this location. I ordered take-out and the girl that rang me up was very nice but that was the only good experience I had here. I won't be returning due to the quality of the food. Do yourself a favor and go to the REAL Floridino's in Chandler--the quality of the food and the price is seriously unbeatable!

This place is Chandler best kept secret...but the word is out!  You might wait an hour on a weekend if you don't get there early...but it's worth the wait!  We love to come here for lunch or breakfast...the staff is great, the food is out of this world!  You have to try their pizza muffins!  Our favorite is the buffalo chicken ones and we love their Greek salad, but everything on the menu is amazing!  For desert, they have the Italian cookie, although they call it something else, but it's so yummy and the prices are great!  We love this place!  It's one of the few places our whole family can agree on...

I went here and had a wonderful calzone and cookie covered in ice cream!  The calzone was huge.  The place was clean and family oriented with plenty of space between tables.  It was great for a group dinner!  Service was good.  Will definitely return.

I have only ordered delivery here.  But let me tell ya, these guys are on point!  My deliveries have always been spot on.  Extra this?  Less of that?  Delivered.   I love the cheese pizza and antipasta salad.  I asked them to leave out the cheese on my salad (cause it's gross to me) and they subbed extra meat!  I love you guys!!!!    Fan for life

I had the pizza muffins. They taste like pizza, really good pizza. Yummy and hot with marinara and ranch dressing. There calzones are delicious. There pizza rocks and lots of specials every day! Seniors Monday 2 for 1 dinners. Hurry on over for some tastes of Italy!
Great crust on pizza and calzones good local joint.

I picked up an XL BBQ pizza, an XL pepperoni pizza, bread sticks with cheese and small chicken Caesar salad.  The pizzas had a lot of toppings and good sauce but I am not a big fan of the crust, which is really important to me.  If it isn't as good in the morning cold I won't go back.  The bread sticks were good.  The Caesar salad was ok, nothing special.  One thing that was strange was having tomatoes in it, I have never seen them in a Caesar salad before.

They are our go-to for excellent Italian food! Very affordable food, wine, and dessert! I love their homemade lasagna and we always get a cookie with icecream for dessert! I highly recommend Flordino's in Chandler!!
Just moved to town and decided to try this place out. We loved it!! Service was great, our server was very friendly and helpful. Food was delicious!! I'll definitely be back again.

I love to support local family owned businesses that run a great operation and knock it out of the park!   Floridino's gets it done on all operating levels.   This is a place you can go to on a date. If they call you back for a second date, they might not be a gold digger. So remember;  " "Jumpman , jumpman, jumpman, them boys up to something  She was trying to join the team I told her wait   Chicken wings and fries we don't go on dates!!"  Sorry I digressed. So back to the question at hand..should I go? Yes.   I read review after review and all were positive expect someone that actually said they ordered from Grub Hub and she thought Olive Garden was better. That girl was just ridiculous. Rate grub hub down not this place you ninny.   Ordered the lasagna and it was really good. The sauce was very tasty and just the right amount of cheese. For a $1.99 got the Caesar salad and it was decent. I like lots of garlic in my dressing but that's me. This is a good little salad with fresh tomatoes.   The bread was sooooo good! I was using it at the end of my meal to clean my plate of all the remaining sauce. It's like a pull a part bread and not a traditional bread stick and I loved it.   Next item ordered was the Fettuccini Alfredo with veggies. The sauce was very tasty and never clumped or separated or was oily or greasy. It was just a very rich, creamy and smooth Alfredo sauce !!!   Kids personal pizza with a drink was an extreme value. So this restaurant is very kid friendly as far as single moms and dads going somewhere nice to enjoy a nice dinner out. Or just families like the Brady Bunch that want great food and are value oriented.   They have glasses of house wine that are a good value and I even saw a Malbec on the list.   I also like that they support local breweries like SanTan and Four Peaks but also have Mich Ultra.   The service was great. Most of the servers  were younger kids, but they were all about being attentive and providing a great overall dining experience. They are the frontline of any good restaurant. Hats off to management for training your staff so well. I always say smiles are free and accomplish so much.   You've captured me as a new customer and I will be back soon when I want to carb out!! Lol.

A very homy place, really a pride of Chandler. Nice and accommodating service crew from the moment you step in to the time you finish your meal.  Two signature food you must try: the calzone and the pizza muffins, there is a third one and it is already inclusive with the two orders and i'm talking about their marinara sauce which is just a bomb of greatness. As you try these flour-based items, take the time to taste the richness of their fresh baked bread, yeah, it's that good.  Bread and tomato - if you can't enjoy its creations on an Italian restaurant, then i say look for another one because these are the very basic ingredients that make an Italian cuisine unique. Try their spaghetti with meatball and you'll know what I'm talking about.  The place is almost always packed, so be be patient and be rewarded with a delicious meal. They have Seniors Night, Kids Eat Free and Lunch Specials, at any rate i still consider their pricing affordable and reasonable. Buon Appetito!

This place is one of my all time favorites. I've been coming here since high school (over 10 years).   Get the Calzone!! So amazing. If you haven't been here give it a try for some great Italian food!

My family loves to go to Floridinos. It's a great place when we all get together (about 18 of us) or when we have family come in from out of town. They can always get us seated in a reasonable time and are quick with the service. It's a very low-key, no-frills type place. We usually just get a few pizzas and share. The white pizza with chicken is my favorite! I love garlic and the white sauce has a nice roasted garlic taste to it. The regular red sauce pizza is great too. If we are over on this side of town for lunch we like to come and get their lunch special which is a personal sized pizza, salad, and I think it comes with a soda? Not sure on the soda part. Either way the food is always piping hot, the salads are crisp, and the staff is always friendly. There've been times when I knew we were being loud or a bit obnoxious but they've always been helpful and kind. Great service, great food, great prices.

Just an average restaurant. With the exception of the baked spaghetti, which is fabulous, the food is not very good. Pizza is tasteless because the dough is unsalted. Salads are watery and mostly iceberg lettuce. Decor is plain. Looks like the interior of a diner more than that of an Italian restaurant. Service is good, although nothing special.

First of all, I've never lived or been to NYC so my review might not be helpful at all to the ultimate pizza lovers.  I usually like Papa Johns or Round Table Pizza so that should tell you my lack of expertise on pizza.  Now, if you still want my review, here it is...it wasn't my favorite.  Would we go back? Probably, NO.  If you want good Italian, try Vincitorio's.  *Shrimp Scampi Pizza......yeah...no, it definitely wasn't for me...it was more like hardened pasta and tiny, pre-cooked shrimp on bread. *Calzone - pretty good. *Decor - I'm definitely not used to the "authentic NY" style....
We have been eating here since the 90's. Great food, love the pizza rolls. This place can get very busy during lunchtime, and weekend nights.

I've been to this restaurant twice now recently to try it again. The first time was a rather busy time and I get the quality of service was lacking due to the rush. Of course we had a bit to wait, no big deal. And service was slow. I get it, the dinner time chaos.  The second time I went,  it was not during a rush and it still took a while to seat us and I was staring at several open tables, took a long time for the waiter to come by and take orders. Food is good for the value, typical Italian place and items. Though in the effort to be inventive, the doughy treats they created looked tasty on the table cards but it did not cook all the way through on our order and ruined my appetite. Both times the service was lacking and unfortunately I won't go back now. Not only for that but the restaurant itself is super small and they try to cram as many tables in there as possible. It's super hot inside too when it's packed. The ambiance for me in general was awkward and uncomfortable, you're so close to your neighbors so it felt a little invasive for me to be so close to strangers.

The food here is great and they have several reasonable lunch specials.  RIght around $5 gets you a drink and personal pizza.  Service is good and if you sit at the counter, you can bet that Mike or Chris will be there to greet you.  I would definitely recommend going here.

We had a Floridino's by our house that closed so we started going to this location (it's owned by a different person than the one on Alma School and the one that closed).  It used to be really good, but the service has gone down so much.  If I could give zero stars then I would...it was that bad.    Took a long time for our order to be taken, waited and waited for food...about 45 minutes later we were given our bill before our food arrived, then our appetizer and salad came after we finally got (and finished) our pizza.    When I asked for a manager the waitress got an attitude and refused to get him, so I walked up to the bar where he was to tell him of our situation.  He said that they were busy (um...four tables is NOT busy) and that he didn't really care.    I told him we would no longer come to his place after being regular customers for years.  He said, "Oh well, I'll still be here anyway."    Food is great, so we will only be going to the original location from now on.
Definitely try the pizza muffins! The interior reminds me more of a family restaurant, say like a Denny's, rather than an Italian restaurant.

I always leave floridino's happy and with a feeling of always coming back soon. Food is great, and I recommend the pizza muffins for sure. Service is always top class, very polite and helpful. They also have a lot of tv's so you can catch any sports games you want. It is a spacious place and can fit a large party.

I live in Mesa and wandered in by chance.  I am always treated like royalty and so is my family when we eat here. I am always surprised when I read super bad reviews of this place...and the people also mention the "other" place with the same name.  I went to the other place and enjoyed a meal there.  They were good....but seemed like less space. If I were the Yelp readers, I would try this place for themselves.  And for the person who complained about tomato sauce being on their food(they were allergic to tomato sauce)...why would you go there?....I am also prohibited from having tomato sauce...but in an Italian place I would order a salad without tomatoes and have breadsticks.  No sense setting yourself up so you can whine about the inevitable. Enjoy!

We just returned from Europe and swore we would never eat Italian food at a chain restaurant again.  we searched for a family restaurant with good food.  We went to Floridino's and had pizza and the pizza muffin appetizers.  Everything was delicious!!! We went early, they were almost full, a good sign.  The girl up front was friendly sat us right away and told us her favorites to order.  The service was excellent.  we will be back!!!

I used to really like this place, went there a lot. But my 4 year old daughter was throwing up the meat sauce lasagna from this place all night every hour for 6-7 hours, starting 5 hours after she ate it. She is fine again this morning, but went through the seven levels of hell last night. I called them this morning and was extremely polite considering the situation, sharing what happened and asking if anyone else had shared issues with the food last night. They were very uncompassionate, saying "we are well versed in food handling" and "yeah a lot of people are getting sick lately" like she had a stomach bug or something. She had a stomach bug for just 7 hours, exactly 4 hours after she ate your lasagna? Come on guy, I know you're not looking to take liability, but you can at least express a little concern about my child (and at least ACT like you're going to be more vigilant) if you're going to avoid taking responsibility. It's not like she had a $3000 hospital bill I was asking you to pay for, or like I was being rude or yelling. A lot of families go there, and I just wanted to give the restaurant a heads up so they could do whatever they needed to do for this to not happen to another sweet little kid again. Poorly handled aftermath AND food poisoning. My advice? Stick to the pizza rolls/dryer food items if you insist on going there. Stay away with the littler ones until they have a bit stronger stomachs!

I've had Floridino's pizza muffins for lunch many times when I worked nearby, but have never dined-in (or tried anything else).  We decided to give it a shot and made the 35 minute drive!  When we arrived, there were a lot of people out front and sitting inside, we figured there would be a wait, but surprisingly we were sat right away.  Our waiter was friendly and answered all our questions.  We ended up getting the pasta with spicy pink sauce, a pizza, and chicken pizza muffins.  The pizza and pizza muffins were good (as usual).  The pasta was just ok.  We asked what made the pink sauce spicy and were very surprised to know that it was Sriracha.  I thought we were at an Italian restaurant?  Sriracha?  Really?  The sauce was also fairly bland as well.  Pretty underwhelming to say the least.  I think we'll get pizza muffins if we're ever in the area again, but most likely won't get anything else or dine-in.
Great food!  Wonderful atmosphere!  A++++! Pizza is great!! Wonderful to find a great Italian restaurant!!
Good food, cheap, family owned.  Not much atmosphere, but the food and the prices make up for it.

Love the atmosphere here and the waitress was super nice and friendly. The cheese garlic bread sticks were very good. The downside....the pizza. It was soggy and greasy. Normally that doesnt really bother me however that plus the weird tasting sauce just made it sub par.
This place is absolutely amazing and family friendly. For any new customer, I recommend the pizza muffins!!
Pretty standard pizzeria. My family loves the pizza muffins.  The pastas and pizzas are great too.  We've never had a dish we didn't like.

Let's just start off been coming here since 2001 getting the same thing over and over again chicken Parmesan and a side of Alfredo it never gets old Hot food great price don't forget to order pizza muffins bomb.com
The food here was amazing but if you want to eat today and not tomorrow order ahead of time. The service is very slow. The waitress didn't seeing to be moving with any hustle.

The special calzone is so yummy! I have been looking for a place that served their calzone with mozzarella cheese and not ricotta. Got to say this place is great! The cheese, marinara sauce and bread of the calzone-Amazing. :)
Food was awesome as always and we seated in a fast manner. When we had 9 in our group.  Jeff gave us excellent service we were very pleased.
Great service, great food, great value, and my wife may leave me for the chicken wing rolls.  Highest recommendation I can give...

I was there last night for a group event and in the plus column there's the service, the huge private room and the service. On the minus side was the bathroom. I'd rather the bathroom smell of clean because it's clean than reek of aerosol deodorizer because it's not.  I can't say much about the food as we only had the choices provided, which were good. Someday I'll have to try the calzone everyone raves about.
Excellent food and prices! The lunch specials are fantastic. All the employees are super fun and give your experience and comfortable, familiar feel. I love eating here!
I looooove this place. Super yummy personal pizza that fill you you up without leaving you stuffed. Such nice people, and they just recently updated it as well.

This is a favorite of ours when we don't want to spend a lot of money but still go out and have a nice time.  The employees at Floridino's are so friendly and welcoming, you'll feel part of the family immediately.  Just as an example of how affordable this place is, the last time we were there we had a half order (6) original pizza muffins, 2 bottles of Stella cider, 1 Sun Spot draft, and one 12" pizza with sausage and mushrooms.  Total before tax and tip was $23.25.  Can't beat it.  I can see why they've been around as long as they have, and get as busy as they do.  Good food & drinks and always great service.
Try the pepperoni muffins and custom calzones.

My parents have come here about three times and finally convinced me to try Floridinio's. The pizza here was so crispy and flavorful. They wood- fire their pizza and it comes out hot it was so tasty too! It's definitely the best pizza I've had in a long time. What really made the trip worth it was the bread pudding with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream- it was perfect for the cold weather. The only reason this wasn't a 5 star review was because of the service. The service wasn't bad! It just wasn't great. 10/10 will return.

Real deal Italian food in the Arizona Suburbs ain't the easiest to find, but Floridinos is always my go to! I love this place, have been coming here for years since I lived in Arizona and every time I come back for visits home! Their lunch specials can't be beat, the prices and flavors are amazing! I love their baked spaghetti and any of their pizza muffins are awesome! Be sure to expect a wait if you come during the lunch or dinner rush!

We LOVE Floridinos!  We have been eating here for 14 years.  We started eating at one of their other locations in Northeast Mesa (since closed) and now go to the one in Chandler (the original location).  I've always ordered the manicotti. It's delicious and I always eat half and save the second half for lunch/dinner the next day.  My husband used to eat the special calzone at every visit but has recently started trying new things.  The environment is casual and family friendly.  It's always busy and you often need to wait for a table.  You can call ahead to get your name on the list but they do not take reservations.   Hands down favorites - PIZZA MUFFINS.  You will not be disappointed.  We go with the regular cheese muffins.  They are amazing.  Ask for a side of ranch and sauce to go with them.  Everyone raves about them.  We take many out of town guests and family members - definitely a hit.  Second favorite - PIZZA COOKIE DESERT. heaven.  need I say more?  Our kids beg us to come here for special occasions because the desert is amazing.    I'm also a big fan of coke products and love that Floridinos has them!  Bottom line, if you are looking for a relatively inexpensive, family-friendly restaurant, try it out. Kids eat free on Wednesdays too!

After reading multiple Yelp reviews on this business, I decided to come here for the greatest hits: Pizza muffins, Calzones and Antipasto salad.  I thought the pizza muffins were interesting and a great alternative to bread sticks or garlic bread. They were loaded with TONS of sausage and ham and came with 2 different dipping sauces. Although a little greasy and re-heated, I appreciated the novelty factor.  On to the entrees, the small Antipasto salad (5.99) was absolutely filling for a one person meal. I didn't find it any different from any Antipasto salad I have tried before, but I think people love it for the dressing - which had flavor but A LOT of oil (more than half of the total dressing). The ingredients were fresh but there is nothing out of this world about iceberg lettuce and dry mozzarella.   The calzone was larger than a newborn baby and hotter than Phoenix in the summertime. Although the corners are mostly (if not all) bread the taste was very good and overloaded with tasty insides. The spinach ham combo my friend ordered was pretty satisfying and this meal could easily be split in 2 for tasty leftovers... if you can stop eating.  I found the teenage staff to be friendly and cheery but the bathroom needs massive help. Only one stall and really unpleasant smells, the female employee who had just left the bathroom as I entered left wet paper towels on the handles of both exit doors... covering the entire area for me to hold on to and pull. Just.... disgusting, especially from an employee who should be trying to keep the establishment clean and good looking.  All in all, good but not great. Its pretty affordable so if this is your price range, I think you can make it work and still have a tasty meal.
Good simple American Italian food. Prices are great. Service is pretty fast.  Avoid Wednesday night as it's Lowery organ test night. Loud old-time music. Not sure why.

I must've come here on a bad day considering all of the other glowing reviews. I've got two things to say about this place:   a) It's very affordable. b) Up until I visited this place, I thought pizza was like sex. That is, there's no such thing as bad sex. Well, the Floridino's pizza just kinda laid there.  I should probably try it again, even though my first visit was underwhelming. One more minor note, this place also has a full bar and it's the first thing you see when you walk into the place. Not sure why that survey question has been answered differently by every other user.
