Another visit this time for business at lunch. Great deals at lunch from $3.99 which includes a drink. Service was great. Not rushed but attentive. Calzone was large and delicious and the pizza never fails. We will definitely return and recommend.

Their calzones, salads, and pizza muffins are great!!! There pastas are okay, nothing special but still good. The atmosphere is very quaint and intimate. Perfect banquet room for a party or shower (I have been to both there) and the pricing is very good. The staff is always friendly as well. I have been going here for about 7 years and I will continue to go!

This is a cool hangout spot if you're looking for a casual meal. I had the original style pizza muffins which were just okay, though they're what this place is known for. My calzone was a bit dry. Food is decent but not spectacular.

My review won't give a full representation as I was there for a painting event. The event was fun but it's hard to eat and paint.   I ordered their healthy choice. It wasn't bad and was priced reasonably.  It would've been nice to have salt for the veggies but again...we weren't at a table with those offerings. Between painting, I took bites but mostly it was cold by the time I could eat. The red wine vinaigrette lacked flavor so I switched to ranch which was good.   The people near me had the pizza muffins and said they were great.

In regards to pizza, this place is a solid 3.  I'd rate them a bit higher if they had delivery, but they don't.  It's probably the second best buffalo chicken pizza in the Chandler area(Rush Street is #1).  Their side salads are probably some of the best side salads you'll find at a pizza place.  Overall, good size pizza for a good price.

Mmmmm Floridinos! The calzone is the most amazing thing on the menu and I have yet to find a comparable calzone anywhere else.  In fact, I ate the whole thing and then felt so guilty that I had hike up to Siphon's Draw the next morning.  Fair trade off, I'd say!  Our group of 4 also enjoyed pizza muffins and salads, and all left happy and full.  A great, local pizza joint!

One of the best fettucini alfredos I've had.  Ordered take-out on the last leg of my road trip because I just didn't have the strength to put on real pants and eat in a restaurant.  -Fettucini alfredo:  Delicious!  The sauce didn't just taste like cream and it had a good consistency.  Too many times I've had this dish and the sauce is like a soup.  The sauce actually stuck to the noodles! -Original style muffins:  I didn't want to leave this place without sampling their pizza menu.  A half order of these muffins seemed perfect!  They have a stellar pizza crust and the toppings were pretty delicious too, very good cheese. -Caesar salad:  What was I thinking ordering a salad?  Maybe the lack of leafy greens on my trip compelled me to do so.  They could've chopped the lettuce into smaller bites and well...SKIP!

Meh! After reading the reviews and the number of times the wait was an hour or more, I expected much more.  The pizza was not much better than Dominoes. The pasta was ok, and the service left a lot to be desired.
Worst Italian food I've ever had. I've given it two tries and Everything I had was incredibly bland and tasteless. I tried the salad, spaghetti, meatballs, ravioli and Alfredo -not one dish was good.

My family LOVES thsi place! It's the only place my husband will get pizza from. We often do take out. Orders are ready in about 20 minutes or so. Pizza Muffins are AWESOME and so are the Calzones!  Great atmosphere when dining in as ewll. Definately recommend it to others!

This is probably our most liked small Italian restaurant, and I can't remember over the past 6 or 7 years when we ever walked out disappointed in the food or the service they provided.  Although we have tried about everything on the menu over the years, their Pizza Muffins, Greek salad, and cheese bread seems to be a family favorite.    My favorite is their ravioli for a dinner size, or their Italian sandwich with a side of spaghetti for a slightly lighter portion.  Their Calzones are huge, pizza is great. Just makes me hungry thinking about it.  Whatever your taste, I don't think you can go wrong here.  Priced right.  Highly recommended for keeping me and my family so satisfied over all the years.

I'll get right to it. The portions are small. I ordered spaghetti and received a small dish with two small meatballs. You have to pay more if you want more meatballs. The only reason I'm giving this place three stars instead of two is because the service and ambiance is great. For the price, I could have had a far better meal at one of the regular places I frequent but my wife and I wanted to try a new Italian restaurant. Maybe their pizza is larger, better priced and tastier. The spaghetti really didn't taste all that great and my wife stated that her dinner was small and didn't taste all that great for the money. We were very disappointed.

This is a great spot for business lunches, group meetings and family outings. The place has a very comfortable feel to it and the food and service are always good and consistent. Love the great lunch specials!

This has been my go to spot for years. The food is homemade and delicious. My favorites are the calzones and the pizza muffins! Sooo good. I don't live in the area anymore but visit whenever I'm in town. This restaurant is a true gem, keep up the great work!

Sorry... I don't see what all the  fuss is about. I found the food to be fair. IMHO they use a lot of convenience items in the kitchen.  To the ownership, good food doesn't come out of a box.or a can  The service was very good
This is by far my favorite place to visit when I am in Phoenix.  Try the breadsticks with cheese and you will crave them forever more.

if you are looking for fine dinning italian and like speciality pizzas or creation, this place would prob be just a 3.  if however you are looking for a good italian place to have a pizza, a calzone or some nicely cooked wings, this is the place for you.  They have giant calzones.  come for lunch for their lunch special, a two toppings of you choice calzone and a drink for like 6.25 :)    Had their pizza and its pretty good too, it does not taste like a chain pizza like dominos and papa johns.  freshly made with good ingredients so its hard to mess it up :)  if you come here expecting olive garden, u will be pleasantly suprised.  if you come here expecting chain store food, u will be impressed.  I think because they get so crowded at lunch, it kind of makes it impossible for them to keep food and reuse them/ reheat it, and the ingredients will always be fresh and not sitting in the fridge for so long.  so, dun expect this to be a palce to move to chandler to, its not that great, but its very good enough to make your choice to move to chandler bearable and adds variety to your choice of places to eat over in the chandler area.

Came here for a quick bite to eat while my car was being worked on up the street.... Not one person acknowledged me. Sat at the bar for 10 mins before I had to ASK for a drink/menu.... There were 4 tables in the place. Not busy by any means. The old lady working was Incredibly rude to say the least. Margret was very nice, she could tell I was getting heated from sitting there and not being helped. I work in the industry therefore I'm a phenomenal tipper. All I wanted was a beer and a salad.... Going to gecko.  I visit the one in Chandler often, the food is delish and the staff is very attentive. I recommend going to that one. Don't waste ur money here.
Love it here. A great place to hang out with friends and family. The food is always great, and the service is always fantastic.

I love everything here from the pasta to the Original Pizza Muffins. All of the employees are always super friendly which makes coming here even better. It can get pretty busy, but it is always worth the wait. They also send us text messages with coupons. Overall, we love this place!

My family  absolutely loves this place. Everything taste delicious and the prices are reasonable. And don't get it Sicilian Sundae because once you do you'll be addicted.  I've tried many things on the menu, and I would be hard-pressed to say which one is my favorite since they are all so good.  And of course, the staff is always on point.

These reviews are cracking me up. They must be family members who are trying to keep this place in business. Please, do not go here if you want anyone to take your order or even acknowledge your existence. And more importantly if you want to enjoy a good pizza. YUCK! I have never seen employees walk in as miserable to be somewhere as I saw them walk into this gross, smelly, boring restaurant. The dude answering the phone at the bar actually rolled his eyes at the person trying to make a reservation for 14. We went out of our way to come here; what a waste of a pizza night!!  Awful experience, and even worse food! So bummed we spent any money here. Won't happen again.

I'm from New York so its really hard to find authentic Italian food!! i will say this is one of the many places i like to go and eat!! i tried the pizza, eggplant and butter squash ravioli and they were amazing!! i would come back!!
Such good food and great Service! They have weekday specials. I usually do take out the food is always fresh and Hot! Highly recommend!

Pizza, again???  Oh, well, what else can a 5 year old ask for on a Saturday night!  We tried Floridino's (or Floridema's)  on Guadalupe Road.  We've been there before and enjoyed their Broccolli Calzones.    The interior is a little dated, but clean.  It wasn't very busy, but that's fine with us.  We ordered a 14" White Pizza and a KIDS MEAL personal pepperoni pizza.  Just have to have root beer with all that!  The pizza came piping hot!  The crust is so light and airy with a crunch that you'd expect on the bottom.  My son ate half of his personal pepperoni pizza and loved it.  Saturday was Karaoke night and my son has no shame!  He sang Journey's "Lights"...  LOL!  Being his parents, we just dated ourselves...yikes!  I should start playing Skeleton Witch in the van to be more hip...is that an "in" word?

I recently had my sister's babyshower in their banquet room and the event manager took such great care of us from our beginning communications all the way up until the day-of. There was a nice large-screen TV available for our slideshow to run on, very nice table linnens provided, and even extra tables when we needed them. For the price, food quality and time availability, this was defintely the best deal in the area for our get-together! Highly recommended.

I love Florindinos with all my heart. I've been going here since I was a kid and still have their pizza frequently. Lovely family restaurant with staff that has been there for years. Their pizza muffins can be personalized and delicious!
Pizza Muffins! If you go here, order a dozen. They're pinwheels of ham, sausage and cheesy goodness! You wont be disappointed. TRUST!

This is my go to spot. Very affordable and family friendly. Portion sizes are huge. I love that they have specials throughout the week. Kids meals are very affordable. My favorite thing off the menu is the chicken alfredo. My favorite appetizer are the pizza rolls, the ranch and marinara for it are like crack. So yummy!

I was really excited to try the pizza muffin because everyone is talking about it (on Yelp too) but overall its really just okay. There isnt anything special that they add to it, its just pizza in a different structure. The regular ones have sausage inside but nothing really special about it.  The pizza was average, cooked perfectly fine but flavor combination of toppings and crust was just decent. Definitely solid pizza but nothing that stands out, sort of like the Pizza Muffin. If you want a safe pizza place that will not disappoint but wont blow your mind either, this place is fine for it.

I've tried to like this place because I live close.  The prices are reasonable and the staff is extremely courteous.  But... I've tried numerous pasta dishes and found them all lacking.  The red sauce is too sweet, the Alfredo is bland, and the "pink" sauce tastes  somewhat like spicy nacho cheese.  Which might be ok on tortilla chips, but not butternut squash ravioli.  My advice: stick with the pizza muffins.  They're great!

My now wife and I had our first date here and we have  frequently visited the restaurant over the past 8 years to the point that a few of the staff know us and always say "see ya next week."    Last night, we had Floridino's cater our wedding. My wife and I would like to thank you so very much for helping make our special night that much more magical.  Sarah was amazing to work with and made the whole process incredibly easy for us.  Thank you, again.

Started off with OK service the waiter we had was pretty rude and inappropriate. Other than that the food was really good my husband and I both ordered calzones (which were enough to fill up four people). I would recommend going to this place for fast Italian food but not the service.

Always a treat. The only thing that I can complain about is how crowded it is, but hey that just means its good! We always get their pizza rolls with ham in them. They taste amazing and make amazing leftovers too. They alone are enough to make a meal. I've also had their pasta which tasted very good. I do wish they would make it a bit brighter in here, though.

Best calzone around.  Great lunch menu.  Able to support large groups well.  This is a locally owned community friendly restaurant.  Did I mention the calzone?  Nom. Nom. Nom.    Awesome to see fixes to large group service.  Have had multiple large groups on busiest times recently and the service has been FLAWLESS!

Great for lunch!  LOVE LOVE LOVE this place for lunch.  Go here often for lunch, they're quick and have GREAT lunch values.  The calzone is HUGE and you can get it (along with a drink) all for $5.99.      It always gives me at least 2 meals.   Along with being a great value,  the food is also very good.    I did not give the 5th star because I really think you need to have all aspects of your resturant be great to be rated  5 stars.  I planned a going away party for a coworker recently and he wanted it to be at Floridino's.  I called to talk to them about out up & coming lunch going away party/meeting and discuss # of people to confirm they would be able to accomodate us.   The guy told me he can write us down but they get very busy at lunch and he cannot guarantee us a table.   Having been there for lunch on multiple occasions I can confirm they get VERY busy.     I can understand if a company does not accept reservations and I explained that to him, but I was bringin 12 people down there  for a work lunch and we couldn't wait for 45 minutes, if they couldn't accomodate a party that size over lunch that was ok, but I needed to know.   We ended up going and got seated just fine, but I would certainly not say the planning staff was easy or all the pleasant to deal with.       I'll still go here for lunch often, but would shy away from any bigger group outings here in the future.

Decent pizza and great antipasto salad. The thin crust pizza lacked in flavor. Not enough sauce or toppings even though I ordered extra cheese and pepperoni. But it was good. The antipasto salad we got to accompany the pizza was definitely the best part of the meal.

For some strange reason I was craving fettuccine alfredo so instead of going all the way to Olive Garden or trying alfredo from some random place like California Pizza Kitchen, we decided to try take-out from FloriDino's. We'd ordered pizza muffins from here before because we live in the area and didn't want to drive all the way to the Chandler Floridino's for them. (The pizza muffins are not as good at this Gilbert location, by the way)  Well, we were less than impressed. My boyfriend got the baked spaghetti with meat sauce and I got fettuccine alfredo with chicken. I tried the BF's baked spaghetti and it was just okay. My fettucine alfredo was totally BLEH. The noodles were overcooked, the sauce had no flavor and the chicken was grey! Chicken isn't supposed to be grey, right? I had to add a couple shakes of my own parmesan cheese, salt, pepper and garlic powder to even give it a taste! Needless to say, I did not eat the chicken so I can't really comment on it's flavor.   I don't plan on coming back here and will be driving to the Chandler Floridino's for my future pizza muffin needs.
We had fantastic catered food. There was a hiccup with the order that caused an inconvenience but we were compensated more than fairly. Can't wait to try this restaurant again.

The pizza muffins are fantastic - get those and an antipasta salad with a glass of wine and you will be happy!!!  The antipasta salad has lots of vegi's, salami, cheese, and a fantastic italian dressing.  The pizza muffins are rolled up pizza dough, sausage or ham, cheese, and they give you 2 dipping sauces with them.  The pizza and pasta are also good at Florindino's.  Great mom and pop family local Italian restaurant that you must try.

I really like this place. The food is consistent and high quality, and the prices and service are excellent. They are often busy and the actual restaurant decor, etc. is nothing special, but you are there for the food, right?

It's so nice that there's still hometown restaurants. And especially this one, it is so delicious! Favorites -spicy chicken salad, sausage and mushroom pizza, pizza muffins, calzone, and their lasagna is to die for!

The place is always packed. I don't get it? I've been there twice in the last two months and both times have been less than impressive. Overpriced for the puny portion sizes. And salads are sliced iceberg with toms and cucs plopped on top.  At least the waitress was great.

Worst pizza we have ever ordered. The crust was plastic like and tough. The pizza was not cut into slices and the toppings just slid right off because the sauce is so watered down. We will never get pizza from here again. We were so looking forward to having pizza today and bummed it was so bad.

Extremely average. I was a little disappointed based on the yelp reviews.  I just got a small pizza to go for lunch and here are my overriding impressions: -The pie itself was incredibly underwhelming. It could have been something from my old university cafeteria. Really greasy, cheese that slides off the base crust, and a decidedly rubbery crust.  -Located in a strip mall in a part of town that time seems to have passed by. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but the theme is continued inside the restaurant. Just uninspired.  -Understaffed... maybe. I stopped in at 2pm, and there only seemed to be one person serving the entire dining area. That said, he helped me as quickly as could be reasonably expected.  Now, it's true, the prices are pretty good. AND I didn't try the calzones which so many here have raved about. In any case, I'm not motivated to return here any time soon.
Pizza, good Zesty bread, good Spicy chicken salad, good Pass the plates and enjoy!: )
Great food!! Nice little family restaurant.  Been going there for years, always a great experience.  Owner Dema always great us with a smile.

Today we had a going away luncheon for a coworker at Floridino's. Most of us ordered off of the luncheon menu. For around $7 the items were a great value. Even though they were slammed at lunch time and we had a large group, we had excellent service.   I had the two item calzone with sausage and ricotta. It was just ok. I just thought it was dry and didn't have a lot of taste.   On a previous visit i had the Pizza Muffins. They were awesome! I would highly recommend those instead of the calzone.

This place is my family's favorite.  We eat here once a week. I love the atmosphere, and the feeling of being part of a big Italian family when you're out for dinner. The service is great the prices are low. We love it here.

Ordered for pick up.  I tried a white pizza which I enjoyed and a pepperoni for the kids. Pepperoni was a little greasy looking but a lil dab of the napkin and it's just fine. Besides it's pepperoni theres bound to be some grease.This place was very busy when I stopped by that night. Looked like a great place to go to with a friend to have a beer n watch the game or even to bring the family and friends out for dinner.
The food here is usually good. Pizza is fabulous! Eggplant was from freezer n def not fresh. Sauce is decent but from now on will only order pizza....
Our favorite pizza place!! The pizza roles are amazing. I've had the pizza, calzones and cannolis all of which are extremely delicious.
Food is very reasonably priced and also pretty good quality. They open at 11 and have some great lunch specials. Definitely worth a dine!

This place is nice and all but when a family of seven comes in with three children one having to be in a high chair and you put us in a booth in the back corner and expect us to squish together is kind of ridiculous.  Need to find some employees with more common sense than that. All I have to say.

Delicious. Great service. Wonderful choice of Italian favorites and specialities. I love the bread they serve with the meals. Nice atmosphere and didn't have to wait to get seated. My husband has trouble walking and we were able to park right in front of restaurant.

My girlfriend and me went to Floridinos on the weekend lunch time. We got seated quickly and our waiter was very friendly with us. I got the spaghetti with meatballs which is my favorite Italian dish and she got the penne with spicy meatballs. Needless to say, Floridinos never failed us again! As always, the dishes were tasty and with the right amount of tomato sauce.  A weekend lunchtime well spent at Floridinos. We will be back

Not my first visit here, but it's been a long time.  Got the two-item lunch special calzone.  Basically it's like a pizza folded in half.  I found the flavor to be fine.  Not spectacular, but fine.  I finished mine.  Portion was reasonable, though they could put a bit more "toppings" inside.  Several bites were just bread.  Can't say I'm a fan, but their food is OK.  Far from the best Italian restaurant around, but not bad.

This was referred by a friend. Thought it was fairly good. The service could use a bit more training and the wait was a little longer with when literally nobody in there was a bit mind boggling but I have to say the food was great. The Jr calzone was amazing. We also ordered these little pizza muffins that were way good. We will definitely come back here for the calzone and maybe the pizza (which I hear is great).

I'm going to be honest here.  This is my third terrible experience this week eatting out. And this is one of my FAVORITE places. Its one of the few great locally owned restaurants that has diet coke. The baked spag and pizza muffins are amazing. 2 of my all time favorite foods that I can only get here.    But I feel the need to report a problem.  This is the second time this has happened sour cucumbers in the salad. I know I'm a pain in the ass  because I always ask for extra.  And the service is great in this place. One of the best in the city. But this is the second time this has happened.  Once I can understand but twice.  There is simply no excuse.  And too top it off tonight our eggplant was raw. I know it was busy and accidents happen but the cucumber thing really angers me its gonna be a long time until I go back.   I feel very guilty giving this place one star but I'm upset.
My favorite pizza joint! Great lasagna.. Salads, breadsticks, and top notch desserts
Great pizza! Love the pizza knots. Always busy and great environment. I do wish the staff was a bit more more friendly at times. Not that there mean but sometimes pretty dry. Love the food.

Gonna advertise yourself as a pizza and pasta joint you better figure out the pasta part of the occasion.  Had the chicken parm.  Worst.  Ever.  Pasta with a sweet Chef Boyardee like sauce, small piece of chicken that was obviously pre-breaded and frozen.  The chicken was cooked but the breading was basically just gummy and uncooked.  Bad.  The "pizza muffins" are a joke.  I hope their pizza is actually good.  Sure, price is cheap, but you get what you pay for.

The family and I love this place.  Services is always so friendly, the owners are super nice and like to talk with the patrons.  If you go, you must try the pizza muffins - yummmmm.    My personal favorite besides the pizza muffins are the calzones.  Very large, perfectly cooked and you can add what ingredients you want.    We all think the pizza is very good.  They even have a white sauce pizza that even my kids enjoyed.    This is a can't miss place

Our family loves this place. So much so that we catered them for our wedding. Nothing but good things to say! Reliable, affordable, and great customer service. Will be using them over and over and over again!

Florindinos is my favorite Italian food spot!  The baked spaghetti and salad are outstanding here, maybe even delectable to the point of being worth a longer drive from another city even!  Portions are good Prices are more than fair Device is usually pretty good  This place gets literally packed with people!  Definitely worth a taste!

Floridino's is one of my favorite lunch spots!  They have awesome lunch specials and the food is always good. $5.99 for a ginormous calzone & a drink - yes, please! No matter how busy they are, the service always seems to be quick and the servers are friendly.  I've never had anything here that isn't good. If you've never been here, do yourself a favor and order some pizza muffins. You'll thank me later :)

A must go for Italian style foods. The dishes were large and delicious.  Loved the sauce and the pizza muffins.  Ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and the sauce was awesomely thick. Highly recommend Floridino's to family and friends.  Look forward to another visit.

Average quality, barely, and lacking in taste and originality. The chains, which I'm no fan of, beat this place easily.   There were a lot of families here... they must have cheap kids menu or something.

AMAZING!!! Brought my girls here for the first time!!  They NEVER disappoint! We had the friendliest waiter and it seemed he read our minds on anything  we needed before we asked. The food was delicious!! You HAVE to try to pizza rolls!! The salads are HUGE, we shared one with all 5 of us. This will definitely be one of our favorite spots!!

Great parking, easy access to the highway, amazing food- their male bartender working was cold and abrasive. Wouldn't smile, wouldn't greet me, acted like I was mentally ill for asking if they served hard liquor, wouldn't change the channel for me- had a female do it for him instead like he was to good to acknowledge that I needed help.. Etc. I recommend the place- if that tall, dorky and moderately handsome fella isn't working.

Such a great first experience, calzones was huge and so good! Not bad for under 10$! My wife and I split it and it was plenty for dinner. The non happy hour beer was priced well, $5.50 for a half pitcher.

I love this company, always on time and I have never had a bad experience at Floridino's. Their staff are friendly, and they know my name/regular order. I have never had a bad experience at the Chandler location!

I had Floridinos cater my daughters wedding in 2012, and it was a very good experience. My son is now getting married , so I thought I would reach out to them again for a quote. I was very disappointed that after leaving 3 messages for the catering department, I never did a call back.

This place is a family favorite! Very casual, great prices, excellent food. Their dishes are simple and comforting. Just a well rounded restaurant. We don't even live in Arizona but when we come to town we always make room for Floridino's.  First things first, order the antipasto salad as a starter. Their calzones are a must. The fettuccine/w chicken is consistently delicious and you can never go wrong ordering a pizza. Don't forget the pizookie for dessert. Yummy, yummy for your tummy!
My absolute favorite! Food is amazing, staff is prompt and courteous, prices are great and it's locally owned by a family that supports the area!

The food is good , our server was wonderful!! The hostess was one of the rudest people I have ever met!! If we hadn't been waiting with a large party we would have left!!  I will order take out from there but won't ever go in again.

If you are looking for an affordable banquet hall for an occasion, this is the place to be. My family reserved their banquet room for a baptism, which fit about 50 people. Their food is good, especially their pizzas! Their service is wonderful as well.   I am all about supporting local family businesses. This place has been opened for years ever since I was like 7 years old (from what I remembered) and it is still around. That tells you something, people just enjoy coming here because of their food and service!

A new date night spot! Me and my husband were looking for a good Italian restaurant besides Olive Garden and we were VERY happy we found Floridino's. We ordered the breadsticks with cheese and they were some of the best I've ever had. For our entree's we both ordered calzones and like a previous reviewer, we too thought they were "understuffed" but still very good.   The prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. We'll definitely try them again and hope our calzone's are a little more stuffed next time!

I got chicken parm with ziti. I like this place for fast italian food. I usually bring it home and add seasonings though as can be a little bland. I like the free bread they give but ask for a side of marinara.

This evening we decided to embark in to a local take out adventure. My wife and I had an incling for Italian. About a mile away from our home in Chandler we are always driving by Floridino's. We decided to give it a try.  My wife had the raviolis with meat sauce and I ordered the baked spaghetti and asked that they add a chicken cutlet into the bake. I also asked if they had any good appetizers for us to share, the gentleman on the phone recommended there pizza biscuits so I figured I'd give them a try. The cheese raviolis were tasty and the meat sauce was rich. My chicken spaghetti bake was very cheesy. The chicken was a 3+, not garbage but could have been a bit moister. I was very impressed with the pizza biscuits; they were very greasy but thats probably why they were so good.  Overall we were really impressed with the food and the order was prepared in about 15 minutes. I definitely plan on including this place in our everyday choices of regulars we enjoy.

Lots of hype but zero flavor. Lots of food but low quality ingredients. I was really looking forward to eating there too! I don't know if the cheese was imitation or just really really bad. My plate was overflowing with food, which I like but not worth our families time or money. VERY DISAPPOINTED.
This place is fantastic! My favorite Italian place. The kids love the spaghetti and raviolis, and we adults have liked everything we have ordered. Great atmosphere, and service as well.

I LOVE the food here!! The pizza muffins are delicious!!! But coming in today, on a Sunday, when it's not too busy, my girlfriend and I chose to sit at the bar so we could both watch the baseball game. After getting drinks we were completely ignored by the guy behind the bar. He took a few phone calls, looked at a few menus with another staff member, but never asked us if we were ready to order, if there was anything he could do for us, didn't even look our way. I asked to be moved to a booth, and we were. Our order was almost immediately taken, and before I could finish this post we had our salad. I'll still get food from Floridino's, but from now on it'll be take out, and it'll be much less frequent.

Had a couple of pizza rolls & some salad on Plant Nite. Food was tasty. Service was fantastic. Floridino's has it down. I wish this was closer to home. Kudos to management, back of house, & service. I will come back when I visit the East Valley.

Great pizza good pasta. The pepperoni muffins and bar b que chicken muffins are the greatest things on the planet. They are so tasty. Staff is super friendly and helpful, they went above and beyond to make my 7 yr old daughter feel special.

We just happened to be driving by and we were hungry so we popped in here. The parking lot was packed and after eating, we know why! The atmosphere is very welcoming, staff is outstanding and friendly and the food was amazing! We ordered the sausage and ricotta calzone, combo pizza and original style pizza muffins and they hit the spot. Service was fast and friendly, food was great and the cost was reasonable! We will definitely come here again!

Floridinos was OK.  The atmosphere is definately nothing to write home about, but I somewhat expected that.  We started with the Pizza Muffins and some "famous" breadsticks.  The pizza muffins were outstanding!  If I ever came back, I would eat only these!  The breadsticks were definately not "famous", they were nothing out of the ordinary.  I ordered a white calzone, which was pretty good, but I thought it was very strange that a chopped up breaded chicken patty was used for the meat?  This place makes it's own handmade alfredo sauce, but we get pressed meat on a patty when it comes to chicken?  Very Strange!  The calzone was average, with way to much dough in proportion to the filling.  One dining companion got the Egglplant Parmesan, and said it was terrific, the other got a salad.  The salad was pretty disappointing as it arrived in a very small bowl, and again was filled with a chopped up pressed meat breaded chicken patty.  The highlight of the evening was the Sicilian cookie dessert, this probably redeemed the whole meal.  It was SO good!  A warm half-baked cookie topped with ice cream, whipped cream, and hot chocolate syrup.  Next time around, it would be pizza muffins and cookies for me!

Just got back from lunch after church on Sunday. It tells you something when the place is packed and people are waiting outside. This place is a gem in a fast food world populated primarily by chains serving the same ol' stuff. This is a legitimate neighborhood eatery churning out food not found anywhere else...yahoo for diversity. This was my 3rd time back and I had never tried the pizza muffins and decided to give them a shot. Oh baby, an order of those and a salad is a GREAT meal! Unfortunately I ordered a calzone to split with my wife....too much food! But, was it ever good! Everything has that handmade, mom and pop look ...and taste...to it which is delightful. I may even go back for Senior night if I can find one of the BOGO coupons out there. Definately a place to put on your dining experience list. Highest praise!

I've been coming here since I was 14 years old, and this place has yet to fail me. The service, the food, the atmosphere... everything is absolutely amazing. Anyone who rates Floridino's less than 5 stars needs help. Thank you Dino's for the amazing food and service!!

My family and friends and I have been eating here for a long time!  This place is never a let down.  The food is top notch, the service is excellent, and the employee's treat you like family.  I have never had a substandard meal nor bad service.  You don't want to miss the Pizza Muffins.  Honorable mention goes to the Deluxe Calzone and the Antipasto Salad.  The pizza is really good too!

We have been to this location 3 times.  The first time there we had lunch & the restaurant was practically empty. The second time there was to pick up a pizza I ordered online. When I got there they said they did not get the order. The person behind the bar checked their computer & saw it. He apologized & started making the pizza. We were given complimentary water while we waited. There was a "band" of 2 old men singing at the front of the restaurant & it was pretty busy. The third time we were there they were about to close & the waitress was very friendly. The pizza is what I would consider New York style because the slices are very large so I either have to eat it with a fork or fold it to eat by hand. The calzones are very large (as you can see in a picture from a fellow reviewer). They do have a large patio but since it is AZ I am not sure how much use it gets. I have not seen anyone seated there in the three times I have visited.
Does not disappoint!  Found this place on accident and it is my new favorite place in Arizona!  Worth the wait!  Great service.  Great food.  Don't miss the yummy bread pudding!

I love Floridinos. Food is good and service is great every time we go. To the reviewer talking about fake reviews.. sorry but they aren't! I have had QT pizza and as far as gas stations go it's the best but it isn't better than Floridinos. Besides pizza though this place has some other great dishes like the baked spaghetti and pizza muffins. Also, the bread that comes with the pasta is always delicious!

Pretty cool little place with some unique menu items, like pizza muffins. Service is very friendly.  Our white pizza with chicken and spinach was pretty tasty and the crust was nice and flaky. (Most of) my party seemed to enjoy their meal and it would probably be a place we'd visit again if we lived in the area.

I was looking for a new Italian restaurant to go to and ended up at Floridinos.  We had a large party and did not have to wait too long.  Our server was excellent, god was good. Loved the pizza muffins. Restaurant wasn't fancy but the food was good, service was great as were the prices. Definitely be visiting again.

Delicious food; excellent service; bargain price.  What more do you want?  I guess I would love for the calories not to count when I eat there.  We had the pizza muffins to start...super good...better than I thought they would be...I dunno the name threw me off..  Then  I had the chicken parm (my go to item) and the cheese was just so perfectly melted on my delicious cutlet of chicken!  yummm..  My bf loved his meal too...I don't remember what it was but I do know we both had stuff to take home...  tasted just as great the next day...  The service was wonderful....like the best I've had in a long time anywhere!    The tab was the same as had I used a groupon elsewhere except I didn't even have to use a groupon...they are just so well priced!   Love this place.  I am for sure going to the gym..and then going back!
We come here a lot. My kids love their pizza and calzones while I opt for the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and we share an order if the jalapeo cheese bread!! Delicious!

This Is a great place to get some quality italian good without breaking the bank. With prices of their plates usually around $7, this is a great restaurant to go to if you want to get the most bang for your buck. Portion sizes are great and the quality if the food is also very good. Not super fancy or anything super special, but it is quality food at a great price.
Wonderful family style dining.....chef modified my pasta primavera to fit my super picky taste. Very nice staff. Great cheesecake! Will definitely be back when passing through agai

I've been coming to Floridino's for many years even though I didn't live in the area. It was one of my parents' favorite restaurants so we would come here nearly every time I visited. Even after my Dad passed away my mother would bring us here when we visited her. Now they are both gone but my middle daughter lives in Mesa so we come here occasionally. I finally bought a mobile home to stay in when I come to visit my grandchildren and it isn't too far from here.   I recently found out Monday night is senior night, buy one, get one free or if you are by yourself, half off one meal. I've been here twice recently and enjoyed both meals. When you get half off your meal you can splurge and order something else with the money you saved. The first time I got a glass of Chianti and the second time I got a Greek side salad.   I was extremely impressed with the service, especially the first time. That waitress was so sharp that when I realized I needed something I glanced up, saw her working across the room pretty far away, and the instant she glanced up and caught my eye she started over toward me. I haven't had that happen in years. Unfortunately, my experience in too many places is at the servers wisk past you without making eye contact and if they do glance your way they act like they didn't see you. Why is that? You would think they would want to provide good service to get a good tip. The second trip wasn't quite as good, I had a man who started out great but then it took forever before he came back to see if I need anything and bring my bill and a to go box. I think they should have all servers trained under the gal I got the first time. Maybe I will start asking to be seated in her area.  I don't necessarily think this place has the best Italian food I've ever had but it's always decent and I will probably keep coming back here just for the sentimental value of remembering my parents in a place they enjoyed so much.

Love this place, it's really good Italian at a great price. I've had nearly everything on the menu and it has all been great every time. My regular meals are the Lasagna with spicy Italian sausage, garlic bread with cheese, pepperoni pizza rolls (muffins)?, their pizza is also among the best. Super tasty, I've turned probably 20 people onto this place over the years, ALL are now regular customers. We drive a pretty long way round trip to go here on the weekends when we go..... Luckily the place is "kind of" on the way home from work, so about once a month, I'll stop by and pick it up for a dinner treat for the wife and I. The place is always clean including the restrooms, (one of my pet peeves). Like Italian? You'll love this place!!!

Fresh ingredients and gi-gan-tic portions really make this pizza place rock! Try the foot-long calzone, or the antipasto salad that easily serves two.   Floridino's is almost always busy (which is generally a good sign) and the tables are rather close together, so perhaps take-out is a better choice.

Here we go again.... well it started with as an office party as do many of these places we go too.  So we were in a rush for lunch (only have an hour and the bosses were eating too).  The staff nice and friendly very helpful and had some pretty good jokes at times.  We were a party of 10 and we all want our food and drinks FAST, and FAST is what we got... This place ROCKS... food was very good and the portions were HUGE, they have these little pizza rolls that are made like cinnamon rolls they were really tasty... I always order the Calzones because I can't even finish one and there really good.  The food came out Hot and fresh and fast as can be.  3 different folks helped to bring it out, so that we could all enjoy our meal together.  5 stars...  I would have given them a 6 if there was one.  Oh and did I mention, we all paid separately and that was not a problem for this guy he was knocking us out.  Clean, descent parking, friendly staff and good food ... "fa-get about it"  "Emoneyblue Approved"

I have tried the chandler location, but had not been here yet.  Taste is pretty close to the original. The prices and lunch deals are different Mc but it's still a good value. Great calzones and the Pizza muffins are . Very nice find so you don't have to drive to chandler. 5 minutes away from my house means that I will be back!

I love this place! I eat gluten free and as many of us know, gluten free products usually don't taste nearly as good as their wheat counterparts but this place has by far the best gluten free pizza I've ever had. The prices are also great! Will be back!

I've lived in the neighborhood for a few years now and hadn't tried this place until recently. I needed an emergency pizza, and it is in walking distance for me. The pizza was really good, so my girlfriend and I decided to go there and try it out. It's a nice place, and they had the football game on, so I'm already liking. Then I find out they have Santan Sunspot Gold! Hello! Really? You had me at Sunspot! You mean I can walk 5 minutes and enjoy a Sunspot? OMG! If they can fill growlers I'll really flip out!  Ok, on to the food, did the pizza muffins, since I ate like 5, I'll say good! She got the 3 cheese ravioli and I got the antipasto salad. They were both superb. We got the brownie dessert, and went home and lapsed into food comas. My only small complaint was that the lighting seemed a bit bright, but the service was really good and prompt. The waiter knew the menu and was very personable. The gf is already asking when we can go back. So it's a winner. I also run into friends here and see a lot of them checking in. This will definitely be a new regular haunt.

LOL I must have been in a food euphoria when I wrote this as I referred to my "husband" whom I was already separated from and divorcing ... weird.  In any event, I've been back several times since and am addicted to their amazing baked spaghetti with meat sauce.  Always take 1/2 home but it is soooooo fantastic especially with their garlic "bread" which is basically pizza crust.  I love this place!
First timers and just fell in love!  The pizza rolls are to die for and we just had cheese this time. Spaghetti and meatballs, butternut squash ravioli and salad...wonderful!!! And we will be back!
Yum!!!!! I've ordered this pizza over and over, consistent and doesn't disappoint!  Great price fast service and delicious, this is our go to Friday night pizza! Yum.

My wife is from Chandler and every time we come out here to visit her family I always look forward to grabbing a calzone here. Also can't forget about the pizza rolls for the drive back to San Diego. I'm hooked to both of  them so much I've never really tried anything else. Anyways, highly recommend the pizza rolls!

I had the regular spaghetti with marinara and meatballs. And the meatballs were good with the sauce but the sauce alone with the noodles was HORRIBLE the marinara sauce tasted like packaged ketchup from in n out! If I were you I would just order the Alfredo like this old man was raving about in the restaurant or have the famous baked spaghetti but I've had way better! I'm never going there again customers were giving me weird looks... So overall my experience at this restaurant was uncomfortable and the food tasted like a frozen meal cooked in a microwave! Do not eat here!!!! I'd rather eat a gas station mexican breakfast burrito

Pretty standard Italian food in my opinion.  We went for my friends birthday and had a party of about 24.  She had called ahead to let them know we were coming, and when we got there they wouldn't seat us until everyone was there.  Then when they did seat us in a little section in back, they wouldn't let us push tables together which just made for awkward seating.  The service was great though.  Drinks came out quickly as did the food.  The food isn't anything special.  We had a margarita pizza which was fine, but I've had better.  The greek salad my friend ordered looked blah.  Iceberg lettuce and WAY too much feta cheese.  My BF said he got a stomach ache from the pizza he ate.   This is my friends favorite restaurant.  I don't think we'll ever go there unless we're attending an event.

We recently had lunch here.  The food is very good, but the restaurant is far from perfect.  1.  We arrived at noon yet it was very warm.  According to a sign on the door it said to close the door to keep everything cool.  It seems they have a/c issues.  2.  We both ordered calzones.  My girlfriends order was wrong.  The waitress says the cook has often gotten orders wrong.  We had to wait 10 mins to get correct order.  3.  There was only 1 waitress.  There was a large party.  Trying to get her attention was a challenge.  4.  I only got 1 napkin and could not get any more.  You would think a pasta place would have more napkins??  5.  Even though our order was wrong we were charged full price, nothing was comped.  We were also charged $1 for ranch.  We were never told the ranch cost money, and most places give you ranch for free  6.  The bathroom was really gross, but ironically cooler than the eating area.  With so many good restaurants in Gilbert I see no reason going back to this place.

Known for originating the pizza muffin. The staff are the best around, and there's very little turnover in this friendly and welcoming neighborhood place.   Prices are reasonable and quality is very consistent.   The local paper has a coupon for buy one, get half off on another entree. But, really no other local spot beats their lunch prices.   I recommend the meatball sandwich and the spicy Italian sausage calzone.

This place is amazing my family and I come here about 2-3 times a month and we have never been disappointed. The staff is VERY friendly and the owner is always there he always comes and asks us how our meal is, we have never had anything close to a bad experience here. And the food here is even better the pizza is the best in town if not the best in arizona. We will always be customers of this place even if we move out of town we would make the drive just to have a good meal. Thanks guys you rock.

This place isn't even Floridino's!  It's now Dema's, though they never changed the sign.  I'm pretty sure they are leeching off of Floridino's established good name and reputation.  If you follow the ACTUAL Floridino's on facebook, you can read about it.       at one point, I actually liked this restaurant until I found out how many issues they have had  with health inspection and sub-par dining standards.  Now I'm just disgusted... Also, in the 2 years I'd been going there, I noticed a high turn-over with the staff.  And sadly, it seems the service has really suffered because of it.          They give a bad rep to the wonderful Floridino's on Alma School and truly aren't even half as good.  Their only saving grace is the sweet older Italian lady who waitresses there.  The only reason they get even one star is because she's wonderful, the kind of service you come back for.  I just wish she worked at a nicer restaurant!

This place is amazing!!  The pizza muffins, Sicilian sundae, and spicy chicken pizza are just orgasmic.    The service is great and the owners are always doing fantastic deals and staying in touch with their customers on Facebook.  They actually read their feedback and respond personally, which is amazing.  And sometimes they'll have cute deals like "Tell the host "Steve is amazing" and get 20% off."  =)    Great service, even better food.  Don't be confused with the knockoff Floridino's on Guadalupe, they're not affiliated, which is why you won't find the same satisfaction and heaping portions.    Floridino's on Alma School, best dining in the valley.  five stars all the way around!
Excellent dinner!  Be sure to try the original style muffins as appetizers. They are awesome.
A huge two-item calzone with a drink lunch special is delicious and a great deal. Great service too! We love Floridino's!

Good prices, decent food. It should be noted on the menu that there is meat in the pizza muffins, but it is not. As a vegetarian, this would have been vital information to know. My calzone was alright, nothing special, but I might return for a pizza. Will update when I return.

Amazing food, always great service, don't usually have to wait too long for a table at dinner time. Try their pizza muffins, you won't be disappointed. They have awesome prices too. My fianc and I eat here quite often and are really looking into their catering for our wedding.

Love the food, staff is friendly. Have eaten their for years and the quality has always been at its best. Never have had a bad experience. Buffalo chicken muffins, skillet cookie, calzones..... well I can keep going and going are all a must try. The only negative thought I can have is they don't deliver!!!! Still can't go wrong with take out or eating in. Have to place them as one of my top 3 favorite places to eat in the valley.

Everything on the menu is delicious here!! I've had it all and love it all. They also have kids eat free on Wednesday's and are always running deals or specials.  Cheap, homey, delicious. One of mine and my husbands 3 dinner places that we always pick.

Casual atmosphere, quality food, friendly staff, decently speedy service.  I first came here when I was in high school and it was great even then.  Now, it is a frequent work lunch spot.  It's slightly small and generally packed and lunch time, but waits are never horribly long.  Your typical menu of pastas, salads, subs, but the thing they're famous for is their monster calzones.  SERIOUSLY, you must come here and try one.  The crust is lovely, the fillings are always flavorful.  And they are just HUGE!  So do yourself a favor and bring your friends.  This isn't the place you'd take your significant other, because it's lacking in atmosphere.  But if your main objective is to chow down on calzone, you'll be satisfied.

The reviews are pretty spot on.  I ordered a pizza and those yummy little pepperoni muffins.  The muffins were amazing.  The pizza was . . . just ok.   I've had many friends tell me that Phoenix just isn't a pizza area and mostly everything is mediocre.  I'll agree with that.  I chose ham and roasted chicken for toppings.  The ham was extremely salty, thin, and watery.  Not really appealing. The chicken was also salty.  The dough itself was kinda limp and not really my style of pizza.  I'm sure better options exist for pizza, but I haven't found one yet.  I was impressed with the service though.  The place was PACKED on a Saturday night.  My waiter was quick, attentive, brought refills often, and the food was out pretty quick.

The place was pretty empty for a Sunday evening.  That is probably why the waitress was attentive to us. I ordered a lasagna which was good but small for $10. The entire plate was smothered with sauce but only a little bit in the middle was the actual lasagna. Their pizza was good but the other dishes aren't worth $10+. So the service was good but I didn't get my money's worth for a simple dish.

Excellent value and yummy eats!  Very good pasta dishes and the bread and marinara was great too.  I added a tossed salad for $1.79....great price.  Many happy people eating pizza, which looked great, and several others coming and going with takeout.

Well I ordered a calzone~ it was delicious. Nice staff. Very busy, which I did not expect at all. Fairly friendly and they have a little bar as well. I had the privilege to be sitting next to the manager's wife. She was able to clarify that this is a family owned business (20 years or so) and the owners are still very much a active participants.  I used to come here with Joyce, an old colleague of mine that has since passed away. Which was my motivation to come in to begin with. A little reminiscing. I will say not much changed ~ and that is such a good thing. Apparently it gets a bit slower and quieter senior night. Can't believe it, but I'll need to call and find out when that is again. Monday's I think? But don't take my word for it. Call and check it out yourself!

One of the best Italian restaurants in Chandler (better than Olive Garden) The food is always delicious and the portions are great. You will leave happy and the unlimited bread sticks are phenomenal. And cant go wrong without the bar, and the restaurant is now more spacious .

Kids eat free on Wed. We usually go on Wed, therefore. They are often packed at dinnertime.  At first, I had a hard time finding something I liked--I didn't like the pizza, and I didn't like the fact that the salad was full of iceberg lettuce. I finally found my favorite--their alfredo pasta primavera with chicken. My hubby and son like the pizzas, and my friend loves the meatball subs. I haven't tried a calzone here, but I hear they are good. The bread that comes with the pasta is wonderful, as long as it's not cooked too long.   We mostly get great and friendly service here, and they have coupons in various places. Found one in a Mexican free newspaper that my hubby got. Found others on the Chandler town calendar you can get at the library or parks and rec.   Other good things--our 1yr old likes tomatoes, and they let us order just tomatoes for him. We've never been charged extra for a bowl of cut-up tomatoes for him.  AND the cookie sundae? mmmmm...fantastic. Baked chocolate-chip cookie w/ vanilla ice cream and whipped cream and chocolate sauce on top, to share.  Also, there are TVs with sports on scattered throughout, as well as at the bar area (where you can also sit and eat).  Something to improve on: often they forget to ask if we need a high-chair or booster seat; then we have to ask and I feel like I'm imposing because they are always so swamped.

Had our staff Christmas party here and what a great job they did!!! Beautiful decorations were provided...surprised us. Server did a great job accommodating 20+ and they allowed us to bring in our own desserts. Their food was delicious...fettuccini alfredo to die for and lasagna, not for me, but everyone else raved.

Well my daughter and I went in for lunch. We arrived at 2:13pm. We were seated and the table was not too clean. The hostess came over and asked for our drink order. I asked which lunch specials came with a drink she then informed me that the lunch specials were over at two.  I told her I thought the lunch specials lasted till four. I asked her if they would honor the lunch specials since it was only 13 minutes after two and was told no. I explained to her that I would leave if I didn't get the special, She shrugged as if she didn't care and we walked out.   The sad part is that I eat at this place three maybe four times a month. The food is great and the staff is always friendly. I'm really disappointed. I hope they were happy that Wendy's got my $16 for lunch.
Standard Italian restaurant. I'm more of the healthy type, and was sad to see that salad/side salad with any entree wasn't included. Manicotti was good but simple, good wine prices.

What's OK:  I don't go to places like this for lasagna, pasta, or your typical generic Italian dishes.  They are usually a waste of an order 90% of the time anyway, and Floridino's is no different.  Those dishes are just fine.  The pizza is... OK.  Sandwiches... not bad.  The good here is value.  The prices are what they should be when you go out somewhere and order a plate of spaghetti.  But you aren't going to order that anyway, right?  What you need to get is an antipasto salad, some pizza muffins, and absolutely a calzone.  I'm not coming here without getting a calzone, they are great.  Combine that with the reasonable prices and locally-owned, family friendly atmosphere and I'm a fan.
Amazing food,  amazing customer service,  clean. If I had one complaint,  they are often very busy,  but they still do a good job getting people in and out.

Been going here since I was a kid, it's soooo delicious! I usually order the Ziti Alfredo pasta with added veggies, comes with a large size of freshly baked bread. Mmmm!! My boyfriend gets the lasagna and says it's "the best he's ever had" Oh and you HAVE to get the pazooki (large warm cookie pie with ice cream on top) at the end. My sisters and I use to fight over that thing, it's so dang gooood
I stopped by here for lunch before working out at crunch. The calzones are huge and great. For the calzones you can get 2 free toppings. This restaurant also has incredible pizzas that are excellent.
Great pizzas and Greek salads, $8 for a large on Sundays! The best cannolis...yummm! Friendly family atmosphere.

I have never been to a pizzeria that is literally packed all the time. That already says a lot about this place. Excellent food and service. We order pizza here every week and we love it.   They have a private party room that is booked every time I'm there. Looks fun!!  We'll keep coming back to this place!

Prices were good, didnt have to wait for a table after stopping in with my family on a late saturday afternoon. HOWEVER, I kept it pretty simple with the chicken parm and was thoroughly disappointed. I think Chef Boyardee made the sauce, it was that bland and distilled of much taste. I am willing to go back for their lunchtime sandwiches on a recommendation and because so many people seem to like the place, but it may just be they havent had decent italian food in AZ much! Just because its got a decent Italian name for the restaurant does NOT mean its worth a visit.

OMGoodness!!! Food was SO good!!! AZ native and my first time here, don't know why I waited so long!! Original Pizza Muffins were delicious and so cheesy! Caesar salad was fresh and crisp, 10" Supreme pizza was perfect for 2 people (6 slices) and NOT GREASY!!!! So hard to find a good pizza place in AZ! I can't wait to come back!!!!

Stopped by Floridinos on way home from work for some take out. Staff was very friendly and food was excellent.  Ordered the pepperoni muffins and and the lasagna with a couple of meatballs and both were great. We'll be back again.
Came here from California looking for some pasta.  Great pizza muffins and breadsticks. Good service too.

This is just a great family owned pizza joint and I love it! The pizza is always hot bath and really really good with lots of tea. I have not tried the pizza muffins yet but I hear they are to die for! I think I will have to try them on my next time around. But honey let me tell you the pizza will make you slap your mama! And the service is awesome too I normally like to sit at the bar get a glass of wine or beer and have my pizza there!

When I saw pizza muffins mentioned in other yelpers reviews I had to check it out for myself.  The boyfriend and I headed to Floridino's for a late lunch on Sunday. It didn't take us long with the menu because we were there for one thing - pizza muffins of course! We ordered a half dozen and a caesar salad.  The food came very quickly but when the server put down the muffins I was surprised. While they looked great, they did not look like muffins. I was expecting a popover type thing. This was more of a pizza roll cut into slices. But like I said, they looked good so we dug in. Each slice is loaded with cheese, sausage and ham and it's served with marinara and ranch for dipping. They had a good flavor and were very filling.  The chicken caesar salad was good too. Lots of chicken and croutons, which I like. We got the small and it was plenty for two people.  In the end our bill came to $10!! (We didn't have drinks) Only $10 for real? Awesome! There aren't many places that aren't fast food where two people can get full for $10. What a killer deal.
Food was decent, not fantastic. We did the muffins, calzone, and a couple pastas. Nothing bad or over the top. Cleanliness was about a C-. Very crowded. Friendly staff. Prices are very reasonable.

Floridino's is a great place to come when you have a craving for Italian food!! Located in an unassuming shopping plaza this definitely seems like a hole in the wall. I hadn't been here in several years since I've moved to the Bay Area now but it was just as good as I used to remember.   The calzones here are out of this world and a really good value especially for lunch! Lunch special for a two item calzone and a soft drink is $6.89!! Another must order are their pizza muffins mmmm... basically like a cinnamon roll except filled with delicious savory ingredients. Don't forget to get extra marinara sauce because it is tangy and warm. The pizza muffins are Cheesy, fluffy, and doughy and everything you love about pizza in a 'muffin'. I haven't had that many of the other options here but did try the fettuccine alfredo with chicken breast which was on point. Cheesy goodness with tender chicken breast that just melts in your mouth, it even comes with a side of breadsticks!
I love this place. They have delicious pizza, pasta, and beer.  I don't know what they put in their pizza muffins, but the thi

Tried a small (10 inch) white pizza with black olives & feta cheese . ($11) The crust was soft and chewy but very light ! The white sauce was perfect with garlic and spices . I would definitely order pizza again , next time I want to try one with their red sauce . My bf ordered spaghetti with marinara sauce ($5.99) it came with a basket of garlic bread that he said was fantastic . The spaghetti looked pretty basic to me but he seemed to love it. Bottom line ...good food,  great prices . *** They run senior specials on Mondays, kids eat free Wednesday's ***

This was our first time there. Service was good. Our waiter was pretty attentive.   The pepperoni pizza muffins were fantastic.  Crispy on the outside, gooey and delicious on the inside.  I expected them to be fluffy and bready like a muffin, but they were more like tiny pan pizzas.   I had the eggplant parm. The eggplant was battered and fried to perfection. Not greasy or floppy like some places do.   My husband got the baked ziti. He thought the sauce was bland,but he tends to like his food spicy.  He loved the bread they brought out with the meal, whereas I though that was bland.   The kids ravioli must have been good because my 5 year old ate every last bit, which is rare for him. My daughter ate every bit of her fettuccini Alfredo.   Overall, it was a good experience. Food was decent. I'd go back and make a meal of the pizza muffins.  4 stars because the host clearly saw that we had a baby, and didn't offer us a highchair. My husband had to wander through the restaurant looking for one.

SO good! The white pizza is my favorite and the best white pizza I've ever tasted! I love Italian food and I'm very picky but this pizza is one in a million. It's a great place to go in a group because you can order a bunch of different pizzas and it's so cheap! It's a great family place as well. I highly recommend this place especially if you like pizza. It is kinda hidden. The outdoor patio is super nice especially when it's cooling off. They also have amazing carbonation in their drinks!
Great food, drove all the way from Buckeye to try the pizza muffins. Friendly atmosphere and amazing Italian food. I will be back soon!!!

Favorite family Italian.  When dining for Six it can get pretty expensive especially for Italian.  NEVER HERE. Prices are very fair and portions are good.   Favorites are Pizza muffins and Calzone is best in Town.  Pasta dishes are great. Never disappointed and always satisfied.

Great pizza, wonderful pasta, and the best manicotti too. It's your typical cozy neighborhood Italian restaurant with great food and it's a well kept secret. Very busy every night but extremely fast and you are never kept waiting

Pizza muffins hands down are the best thing on earth! Growing up in chandler this is mine and my family's favorite spot! Their beer selection is amazing! Pasta, salads and pizza of course you can't go wrong. PIZZA MUFFINS!!!!!!!

Don't go to this location expecting it to be like the Floridino's in Chandler. Two totally different restaurants with the same name. Food is extremely bland at this location, water tastes like mud, and the restaurant is filthy.  Chandler location is the total opposite. Excellent tasting food and great atmosphere. Go there instead!!

Absolutely love this place. One of my favorite places to eat. Their pizza muffins are super delicious! The only reason I gave this a 4 star and not a 5 was because one time I had went and I ordered the spaghetti. Most of the time its delicious but the last time it was like chopped up noodles that were cold in a square form. It was like someone cut up the noodles and put it in a container then put it in the fridge for a while and then microwaved it for 30 sec before serving it to me. Other than that one time everything was great. Employees are super nice and its just like a nice relaxing place to eat.

I've been back a couple of times recently since my last review.  They've raised their price slightly on the lunch special, but the calzones have been much better.  Whatever they changed originally, must have been corrected.  Still a great dine-in lunch for the price and the service is still very good.

The banquet room was perfect for our daughter's graduation party. They set it up to our specifications, the food was delicious, and the service was excellent. Thank you for helping to create a very memorable and joyous event.

It was so hot when we sat down at 8:30pm, we asked if there were problems with the AC. But it turns out the owner turned off the AC when he went home that night, 2 hours before they closed. The pizza muffins and the pizza were burnt. The server was very nice and doing her best. There is no affiliation between this place and the Floridino's on Alma School. This place was not good and not having on the AC, when it's in the 90's already is crazy.

The food here was really good.  Their pizza muffins are yummy!  Definitely recommend trying them and my fianc raves about them.  I got a simple pasta dish that was delicious and he got a salad.  We both enjoyed our meals and will be back!

I've been in that parking lot a 1000 times and never ate there... That was my mistake. Enjoyed this little place a lot. From Lindsey the waitress whom was very kind and took great care of us, to the Fettucine and Spicy Chicken Pizza. Okay the booth seats need padding... but I didn't go there for padded seats, after all i have padding there already (lol).. I went for dinner. It was much better than I expected and I have to say that we'll be ordering ahead and picking up on the way home from work for dinners. That pizza was the best buffalo style pizza we've had and we eat it about once a week.  This is a BIG THUMBS UP!
I had my rehearsal dinner here and the staff was fast and accommodating! Beautiful banquet room! Food is SO good!

I work less than a block from this place and go here all the time.  The food is good and there is always plenty of it...  A very nice local watering-hole and family restaurant.    The lunch specials are the best.  I can eat till stuffed and get out the door for less than $10.  The lunch specials are popular, so there can be a wait to be seated.    I love the baked spaghetti here so much that my wife and I had this catered for our rehearsal dinner.  We fed 35 people for less than $300, and everyone really enjoyed the food.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.
Love this place ! Always get great service and no matter how busy it is there is never a long wait after you place your order . :)

My wife and I came here for a Paint Nite party.  Bought the Paint Nite on Groupon and ended up here because we liked the painting that was being offered.  We had heard from a few people that the pizza muffins were a must so we were excited to try them.  We had the original and spicy chicken pizza muffins and they were just OK.  Nothing wowed us about the pizza muffins.  To be fair though, that was all we ordered so I can't speak to the rest of the menu.  Our server was very nice and attentive but a couple of people behind the bar were a little dismissive of us when we tried to order some drinks.  Overall, this was a decent place a Paint Nite event (nice, large side-room) but we weren't wowed by the pizza muffins as we were expecting.
Hands down the best manicotti in the valley and for more than fair price. If not in the mood for pizza or pasta the oven baked, open faced, super steak sandwich is absolute spectacular!!!

Great food and good service. Pizza muffins are to die for. I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo with spicy pink sauce which hit the spot. Both of my friends had lasagne and had nothing but praises. I recommend Florindinos. Our waiter Randy provided great suggestions and was very attentive.
This place is always amazing when it comes to pizza and pasta!! I really recommend this place to anyone who is in the mood!!!
Had this for a breif meeting and it was so great! The house salad dressing had so much flavor. &the chicken pizza rolls so tasty. Nothing not to love about this place.

Famous for their pepperoni roles  (muffins ).  Original Italian sauce and really great tasting cheese on ziti. Incredibly friendly service.  SanTan beers.  AND they have an event room.   Decent Italian food.

Had the calzone and the pizza rolls as recommended by my coworkers. They claimed the food was amazing and it was really good, but I think there's places closer that I'd rather visit and it's just as good.
Excellent food. Excellent service. Excellent prices.   Amazingly excellent Pizza Muffins!
BOMB!!! There pizza muffins are to die for!! I literally order them for pick up like twice a week!!

super excited to find an Italian place that does delivery and carry out.  all three entres were delicious and my favorite by far was the baked spaghetti.  food was perfect temp by the time I got home and the food was ready exactly when they said it would be, which is impressive for a busy Friday night.  store is located in the Mesa part of chandler but the food was top notch

I'm standing in line at Whole Foods for our family Friday pizza night with a have mozzarella and pesto and half veggie pizza ready to rock and roll. This woman behind me in line mentioned that the pizza smelled good so I offered her a slice.   We got to talking about pizza places around the valley, Pomo, Cibo, Bianco's, etc which tend to be more Neapolitan style pizzas. She told me how good Florencias was which when my wife and I were in Florence Italy we definitely missed  their style.   We decided to check this place out and the pizza is authentic. The sauce on the margarita pizza was extremely flavorful and our waitress was great. We would definitely go back.

I'd give this place 4.8 stars, but only because there is nothing special about the atmosphere, it's really plain.  Other than that it's perfect.  The only thing I've ever ordered there is the calzones, because they are amazing.  I've heard from others that everything is great though, especially the pizza muffins and the bazooki dessert.  Being a calzone fan, whenever I go to a restaurant that has calzones, that's what I will get.  Floridinos' calzones tie for rank number one currently, and I've had calzones from about 10 different restaurants.  These ones are really big!  This time I got a ham, pineapple, and ricotta calzone.  I can usually tell the food is great when I close my eyes while eating it because it is so good.  My friends say it looks like I am making out with my food.  The service was great and quick, I was surprised at how quickly they brought our meals out, and I was in a group of 8 (That said, it was around closing time so they had less customers and probably wanted to get rid of us...something that can be advantageous at most restaurants).  Also, they have a lot more space as they recently added 2 good-sized rooms.  You can't beat the prices here either.  I got my 3-topping giant calzone for less than 8 bucks I think.  A very friendly and attentive wait staff.  Insider's Tip: They have some amazing lunch specials, Mon-Fri, 11-2.  The best is a 2-item calzone with a drink, only $5.75.
Amazing food all around! Service is always good and there pizza muffins are to die for I've been coming here since high school and it's always delicious
I have been back a few times since my first review. The first time I must have had a bad day or the cook did. The pepperoni pizza here is the best in Chandler. Staff is very nice and efficient.

Two words: Pizza Muffins.  This was one of the first restaurant I tried in Arizona when I came out to school.  As I'm from Chicago, I'm semi-critical on Italian food. Floridino's is simply to die for.  Good for broke students on a budget, you can get 6 pizza muffins and a side salad for $6. I've had some of the pasta there too and it's delicious.  Definitely check it out!

Not impressed in the slightest. Terrible customer service. They messed up on my food order and didn't care to resolve the problem and charged me extra. My waitress was snobby and rude. Overall I was very disappointed.

Hmmm.  Usually I only leave 5's and 0's...  I guess I have to adapt and make my rating more applicable.  Food was awesome.  Seriously...Compared to what my mom makes...pretty spot on.    The service (Gina) was impeccable.  Can't say enough good things about her  So...with my new rating system, I give this place a 4.  I definitely liked the food and the service.  But compared to Dominick's (which is a 5), i can only give this place a 4.  Even thought value for the dollar is waaaayyyyy better here.    UGH! I feel so guilty.  I love this place.  But it's in a strip mall...  sorry...  But seriously people, if you don't want a snobby dinner and want to have great "muffins" and service, come here!!!!
Floridino's has really good food! I usually enjoy the ravioli with Alfredo sauce and it is awesome. The owner used to be a customer of mine at my old job and was always so nice and friendly.
Solid sicilian style pizza. Super friendly staff. It's a large dining room with lots of capacity. They have craft beer and wine, too.

Calzones are huge and delicious. Love the deluxe/meat calzone and the white/spinach. Bread/dough is really good and their red sauce is really tasty too. Hubby's favorite is the pizza muffins (which are more like pizza rolls rather than muffins). He makes happy food noises as he eats them. :)  We typically pick up food to go, but  have eaten there several times too. Your typical family restaurant. They have a few TVs up and I think are trying to catch the happy hour/sports fans. Servers are friendly.

Don't judge a book by its cover. On the outside and even inside this restaurant isn't exactly aesthetically pleasing. The place was packed and people are everywhere. They have more tables then they know what to do with. Don't give up though the food ends up being worth it. The wait really wasn't that long for being a Friday night at dinner. Waiting is somewhat of a cluster though. You have people all over the place waiting. It was a cluster for sure. They should work on that. Once seated our waiter was friendly and accommodating. We all heard the pizza muffins were to die for and they lived up to that for sure. I wish I would have just eaten a bunch of those for dinner. They ended up being better than my main course. I wouldn't be surprised if you were full after those though. I ordered a pizza and it was decent, but nothing worth ordering again.  The people I was with ordered the calzones and absolutely loved them so next time I will have to get that. They seemed a little small for my hunger on a Friday night but not if you ordered the pizza muffins before. Overall this place was pretty good though. Definitely get a good amount of food for what you pay for. I will come back.
Most things I've tried here I liked. The baked lasagna, a spaghetti and pepperoni calzone, pepperoni rolls, and the breadsticks with cheese and jalapeos are all really good.

The pizza rolls are pretty dern good. The calzone is just ok. We were told the meatballs and breaded chicken is not made fresh which is a disappointment to me. Its good but when going out, Id prefer fresh made ingredients. Its good for a quick and inexpensive dinner. Haven't tried the pizza. Husband has had the baked spagetti which is pretty good.

Take a walk with me. Close your eyes. Picture a cinnamon roll. Replace the dough with pizza dough. Now, replace the cinnamon with cheese and any topping you can imagine.
