Finally, instead of dipping this in frosting, taste the home made ranch and marinara sauce. That, my Yelpers, is a Pizza Muffin.   Besides the Pizza Muffins, their Italian food is quite authentic. I have had a little of everything, and I have yet to find something I don't like.  The staff is great. It reminds me of a Chicago bar where everyone knows your name, except they really don't know your name. They are extremely friendly and always willing to give you suggestions.  For dessert, the pizza cookie is a must, and after all of that, you can walk instead of roll out of the door, I will applaud you.

They usually have a wait but its understandable once you taste the food. Everything is very tasty and fresh- especially the red sauce- so good! I liked the neighborhood feel to the restaurant and the vibe inside feels welcoming and friendly. Service was good, food was great, and I'm excited to get back for another dinner soon!

This place is the definition of that down home family owned restaurant. Have been here multiple times and service can vary. To get a true test of this place come during lunch time to not be disgruntled to leave during dinner rush hours. I have not had a bad meal here and take out is also a good way to go "call it in".
So much food for the price. Great variety of Italian food, salads, pizza. The atmosphere is very family friendly, although they do have a bar seating area. Very friendly staff

Not even close to the Original Floridinos (the one on Alma school and chandler).   To be honest, the only reason we go to this place out is to tease our taste buds, and save some gas being in Gilbert and all.  Food and meh at best, and a little pricey.  We just need more itailian restaurent in Gilbert,

The pizza rolls at this place are absolutely to die for. I live in Seattle, every time I visit my boyfriend in Chandler we make at least one stop here. We usually create our own dozen with bacon, ham, and pineapple.  110% recommend.

We dined here many years ago and I have no idea why we let this place fall off of our radar. We were looking for something different the other night and found Floridino's on yelp so decided to give it a try. There was just about a 20 minute wait, not too bad for a Saturday night and a party of five. Our waitress was friendly and efficient and the restaurant, although a touch dated, was clean and comfortable. Tables in the area we were seated (just to the right of the entrance) weren't smashed together so you actually had a little elbow room to enjoy your family and your meal. The food didn't take long to be served and drink refills were done promptly. My family raved about the Alfredo sauce and my daughter very much enjoyed her pizza. Guess we'll be back. Thumbs up from this fam!

My family and I have frequented this family owned gem for as many years as I can remember. The food is always consistent and delicious (we love everything from the pizza rolls and pastas to the awesome sandwiches). The establishment is casually quaint, clean, and always welcoming with great service.

First time here. Yelp reviews gave me high hopes. I was going to try either the highly reviewed calzone or interesting pizza rolls. Looks like a cinnamon roll with cheese and pepperoni in place of cinnamon. I opted for the calzone. I am thinking this was premade waiting to be cooked. The ingredients were a little light. I was expecting more. The cheese was mostly absorbed into the bread. The pepperoni and sausage were average. The crust was very thick, very heavy and doughy. It was cooked although very dense. The ranch dipping sauce was very good. The pizza sauce was nothing more than sauce from a can. No spice, nothing added, just red sauce. If Yelp had 10 stars this would be a four. I might try again to try the pizza rolls. For this review 3 stars; the lunch price was awesome.

I've been here a few times and so far I can say it's the Calzones that keep me coming back..  I've had the various pasta dinners, which were ok.( not bad, but not great either).  However, I have been going lately about once a week with a coworker during lunch and their calzones are delicious every time.  Reasonably priced especially during lunch hours (5.99 for a two item Calzone with a drink). Can't beat that.  And every time I have really enjoy my experience from the service, staff, and quality of the food. I have recommended this to other friends and will continue to do so.  Definitely a good place to go and support a local business.
Great food at a relatively cheap cost. Cannolis are amazing here!   I usually order the ziti with meatballs.  Orders come with fresh bread.
Been here 4 times and every time the food is 5 stars all the way just wish they were closer to us.  They also have great lunch specials
Floridinos Pizza NEVER disappoints!! Great pizza, salad and these little appetizer rolls that were the perfect compliment!! So good
Excellent pizza muffins, very unique. Great family environment, highly recommended......

Most amazing Italian restaurant!  I live easily 20 minutes away from this location (all freeway) and I will make the drive every time! I even pass a different Floridinos location to come to this one.  Any item on the menu will never disappoint, but  2 "must have" items are  Pizza Muffins, a starter  Baked cookie, a desert   I love everything about this place. The staff is friendly, food is to die for.  Highly recommend!

Love this place. Came for the first time tonight for their $6 large pizza special. My hubby and I got half cheese half pep. We also ordered the pep pizza muffins. Everything was fresh & delicious. Love love love their sauce. Prices were so reasonable. Waitress was pleasant. We will definitely be back.

Here in AZ for vacation and trying to stay away from chain restraints and try some local spots!!! This place is hands down amazing .. prices are great, service is fantastic and food is delicious! We had the pizza, chicken Alfredo, and spaghetti  !!! I am definitely coming back here on my next trip back!!!

I'm new to Chandler so I need to rebuild my list of great spots.  I ordered online tonight for Floridinos and it was a great experience.  Online process was easy. I ordered spaghetti with meatballs, pizza muffins and a drink.  I drove up at 6.30pm on a Saturday night and the parking lot was packed.  I thought oh no - I'll have to wait but I didn't wait at all.  Food was hot and ready with a separate pick up line.  Spaghetti was really good but I've been living in PA and the pasta there is better.  Pizza muffins were incredible.  Plenty of food for less than $20.  I will recommend it to others and go back again for pick up.  Too many people too close together for me to want to eat there.

I have to say, its so nice to find what I consider, a great family resturant.   They have a great menu selection, and the atmosphere is relaxed and warm. Great family dining.  Being that its an italian resturant, I feel that they serve all of the great traditional italian food, with out the "chain resturant" feel.   Calzones, Pasta, pizza, salads, etc.  Great full menu, with lots of selection!  They also seem to have quite a variety of wine to choose from as well!!  I love it!  Now mind you, I only had a greek salad when I was here, so my experience with eating off the menu was limited, but it was tasty, none the less.  Its a great casual enviroment, and the resturant seems to be well kept and clean.  Warm, friendly staff members, with a lovely atmosphere.

I have finally lived!  My boyfriend and i came here sometime last month.  It was the very first time I wanted pizza more than him. We had been looking at pictures online all morning! (I swear this man could live off pizza, So I definitely get my fill).  We went on lunch and the place was packed.  I was so excited about this place I actually teared up a little when we had to walk away with no pizza rolls. This time we made sure to order ahead and once we got there - there were actually seats so we stayed and ate.  The manager was a super friendly awesome guy.  Really enjoyable to talk to.  The food was amazing! I was so happy to have made it.  It seems the same people come there all the time and give me the feeling of being in a small town Mr. Deeds like pizza place.  Also.. I didnt have one but the size of the Calzones are ridiculous (HUGE!)!  I'm coming back for those!

My wife and I went here in Saturday night and it was packed. It was a 20 minute wait for two. We got a couple of drafts at the bar, which was full so we were standing by the bar...drafts were $4....My wife asked the man working behind the counter, who was taking care of to-go's if we were in the way because we were clearly standing by the service Area and to go counter because it was just that packed. He immediately said no and struck up a conversation and discovered that Jeff was one of the owners.My wife asked if they had wings , which they did not but he immediately suggested the pizza muffins and because it was our first time there hooked us up with a half dozen. This was totally unnecessary but very much appreciated. We were sat in our estimated time and our server introduced himself and seeing we already had an app and drinks asked if wanted another round of drinks and   walked us thru the rest of the menu. The Buffalo Chicken muffins were awesome and filling so we went with a medium 12" pizza with sausage, pepperoni & mushrooms. The pizza was good ....better than all the chain stuff...Dominos etc...not Grimaldi's or Bianca's but not that price either...this is a great neighborhood place serving a good meal at a good price.
Just got delivered from uber eats, what a great value. I got the Greek salad and a small pizza for my son. Pizza was amazing and my salad was very fresh!  Try them out
Service is great, waitress is fantastic.  Pizza muffins are a perfect idea, you could just have those and be happy but you would be missing out on a great pizza.

As some one who has been coming here for years, I can tell you the items on the menu are hit and miss. My family loves the baked spaghetti, pizzas, calzones, pizza muffins, and eggplant parm. I've had several of there other pasta dishes (eg: alfredo) and was not a fan. You just have to know what to order from there. The pizza and calzones are awesome!!!!!!

Disappointed.  I ordered Chicken marsala with a side of spaghetti.  The cutlet was basically chicken fried chicken covered in marinara that tasted like it came from a can.  It was topped with a blob of mozzarella.  The spaghetti had the consistency of Chef Boyardee spaghetti.  I ordered a pretty standard beer but received only 3/4 of a pour because the bartender said they were out (at 5:30 pm?) with no apology or offer to try a different beer.  I know why people like this place: it has a convivial atmosphere and low prices. But enjoying the taste of the food?  I don't know.

Grew up just a few blocks away from this place and never went in.  Don't let the outside fool you!  Tasty, family-friendly pizza joint.  Seems to be a family running it.  Food was above average and the service was great.  Even the pretty picky stepdaughter enjoyed it!  We went for plain cheese because my New Yorker husband always has to start with a plain cheese "pie."  Give it a try!

Driving into the packed parking lot, I knew I was in for a treat. And even though the place was jam-packed AND had some private party going on, everything was great.  Being new, I asked the server -- and my dining companion -- for a recommendation. First impressions count! I received the calzone, which was as massive as advertised. Then again, all calzones are pretty massive. Now, it's hard to screw up a calzone. These guys don't go for fancy. Good bread, normal ingredients and sauce on the side. It was delicious.   My dining companion ordered something strange called "pizza muffins", I think. Very odd. Very tasty.  I ate half my calzone and took it to go. My kid ate it the next day and wants to know where I got it. But he took my leftovers. So until he pays his own way, I just may hold that information from him.

I second bob r.'s assessment. This place is a super family restaurant - really casual atmosphere. Humongous Calzones, and of course the kids loved the pizzas. I recommend trying their 'White Pizzas' Dee-lish! One thing I really look for when going out is good service and Florindino's was superb, our server was friendly, happy and really took care of my kids - With service like this and good eats on top of that (and a fair selection of adult beverages) This is definitely going to be put on our 'regular' list.

This place has great food at reasonable prices so it is no wonder it is always busy. The white pizza is awesome but I like to get the calzones because I can have something different then the rest of the family and the price is reasonable. This time we tried the pizza muffins and they were great!  No shocker!

I went here on high recommendation... I was told that I would want to move from Scottsdale to Chandler to be closer to this restaurant. Well... I am not moving. I did enjoy it though.  First off, I ranked this place a 3, but it's very nearly a 4. My only issue was the grease. Their food is greasy. It's tasty, but greasy. We ordered a small pizza, famous breadsticks with cheese, and baked spaghetti. The baked spaghetti was supposed to be the best thing I've ever eaten. It was good. The breadsticks were good - it would've been nice had we known the baked spaghetti came with breadsticks - we wouldn't have ordered a separate side.  The table was filled with mounds of bread and cheese. We ended up needing 2 or 3 to-go boxes. I had to soak up grease with napkins. The peperoni was flavorful though. The pizza was delicious. It wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was good.   Nothing was bad about this place - it's very much an authentic classic pizza joint. The place was clean (didn't check out the bathroom though) and smelled of pizza. The staff was nice (though they forgot the meat sauce we ordered with our pasta).   If you live in the area, it's a solid choice. If I lived nearby, it would be on rotation. I won't be going out of my way to eat here, but I will eat here again. Nearly a 4 star rating here. I only wish I didn't feel like I just ate a lump of fat and washed it down with a glass full of grease.

I ordered pepperoni pizza muffins & lasagna for carry-out around 7:45 on a Sunday evening.  The lasagna was just average to me...I didn't care for the sausage in it.  The pizza muffins were good.  I don't think they were as fresh as they could have been but that's probably because I made a carry-out order about an hour before closing on a Sunday night.  The customer service was great and parking was easy.  I may come back to try a different item off their menu.

They have great pizza rolls! There is definitely some good american Italian food here. Whenever I go to Italian places I always order Chicken Parm. There's was the worst I've ever had. It wasn't unbearable but the moment I took a bite I wish I ordered something else. Chicken tasted like it was the frozen kind that was just thrown in the microwave. Didn't taste crispy and fresh like I expected. But our service was good and everything else about our meal was decent. I will be back for a select few things such as decently priced pizza and the pizza rolls.
Absolutely delicious, just as we remember.  GET THE Deluxe CALZONE, perfect.  And split it with someone so you have room for a SICILIAN SUNDAE!!!  Great service on a Friday night!

I went into eat dinner with my girlfriend I ordered my food with no tomatoes because I am extremely allergic.  And I made the aware of my allergies.  When I got my food it was covered with tomato sauce.  I sent it back by the time my girlfriend finished her food I still did not receive my food after waiting 30 minutes my food still was not ready so I tried to just pay for the food that had already been eaten and be on my way. That was not the case however. After asking to pay I was yelled at very loud by the owner. Who was mad I arrived at 8 when the store closes at 9. Then after screaming at me he charged me for my girlfriends food and the food I had not eaten.  Needless to say I wont be returning
Excellent gluten free pizza and my husband really enjoyed his salami/olive pizza too. The small anti pasta did not disappoint. That thing was loaded! This might be my new go to gluten free pizza.
Yummy!! Love love pizza muffins and the cookie!!! Great service every single time!

Tried their pizza muffin for the first time which was delicious.. My friend ordered the lunch calzone and drink for $6 and got more than her money's worth.. The waiter was nice and kept checking on us..

My first choice for a "way-homer" pizza.  (That's a pizza I pick up on my way home from work.) Since Floridino's is in my neck of the woods, I will call ahead before I start my commute home, order my usual (double pepperoni, mushrooms and sausage), and swing by to pick up my pipin' fresh pie.  Have always been pleased with the quality of the pizza here, in particular, the crust. This pizza works best when slightly reheated in the microwave. The crust retains that perfect chew.  Judging from other Yelper's reviews, I should stop by and dine-in sometime. The pasta and the pizza muffins look worth the visit.

I've been coming here for years without issue, but our last two visits we have received horrible service...  We went in on Christmas Eve Eve and after a few minutes wait got a table in the back. We sat there for 10 minutes without a server even acknowledging us... until I finally went up to the hostess stand to ask what was going on. It then took another 5 minutes to have someone come over and it didn't get much better from there. Our waitress was very nice but I've never heard a server apologize so much, not just to us but to the tables around us. She comped our dessert and we brushed it off as an isolated incident and her having a bad night...  But then we came in yesterday....and our server was even worse. Noah was rude and inattentive and I felt like he was mocking me when I asked for extra ranch dressing. (That he never even bothered to bring.) None of us received a drink refill the entire visit. And I asked for to-go lids for our ranch/marina and he never came back with those either. We had planned to order dessert but he set the check on the table and disappeared before we even had a chance to ask. Easily lands on my top 3 worst dining experiences in my lifetime...  I really hope this isn't the new norm for Floridino's.

I went to this place with my sister on Friday, Dec. 29, 2017 for lunch. They have awesome lunch specials. I had never been to this establishment before and after this experience I will definitely be back. The place was packed during lunch hour, but we were greeted & seated immediately by friendly staff. Our waiter was very attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu & prices. I had the calzone at the lunch special price but dinner sized portion. The food was fresh, flavorful and tasty. Amazing Italian comfort food. Upon completion of our meal, we were offered dessert, but had to pass due to being stuffed. Overall, great price for quality food.

This restaurant is in my "hood" and I had heard good things about the pizza muffins so I had to give it a try.   It was busy on a Friday night but we only waiting about 10 mins for our table.  The servers were on top of things as far as I could see.  Our server was at out table in two seconds taking drink orders.  Since it was our first time there I wanted to look over the menu.  He gave us sufficient time and then he was back, took our order, and salad and breadsticks for my daughter arrived in about 5 mins.  The pizza muffins were right behind........ahhhh....these are like crack to me.  I'm instantly addicted!  Little wheels of pizza dough with chesse and ham, fresh and hot and gooey.  YUM!!!!  I should have just made a meal off the pizza muffins but I had to try the pizza.  My daughter had a Jr. Pizza with her favorite topping, black olives.  She gave it a big thumbs up. I tried one with sausage, salami and mushrooms.  The dough was soft, cooked to perfection and has a nice flavor.  The toppings were generous.  It was good and I took the rest home.    It seems as thought everyone there were regulars, locals.  The service was fast and friendly. I thought the prices were very resonable. When we were ready to leave my daughter needed a to go cup for the rest of her drink.  Our server kindly obliged and brought her a to go cup.....filled with more of her drink!  We will be back!  I'm sure I will be craving pizza muffins very soon!!

Yummy, real Italian food, it's our go to place when we are visiting Arizona. Definitely a place everyone needs to try from the baked spaghetti, alfredo cheese ravioli, and the famous pizza muffins you'll leave full and happy, oh little tip grab a to go cup they are massive!

The service at this location ROCKS! From the front door straight thru the kitchen. The venue is cute and quaint and offers a trellis vine covered patio that was largely unused at the early hour that I visited, (11:30am), though I could see myself and a few friends chatting it up while sipping bar favorites and eating pizza muffins, SOON.. The server told me that the establishment has been there for 13-years (+/-), so I know it's not new, however it is greatly under used. Can you say "party of 10, 12, 13?" I can. Easily. So yes, I'm making plans for this place as I speak. The service is good, the food is good and they have ample room. It's a recipe for a good time waiting to happen!

Called GRUB HUB to deliver some good ol' authentic Italian food from Floridino's. I had a craving. Grub Hub was quick in the delivery but Floridino's let me down with the authenticity factor. I purchased the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti + 2 additional meatballs and it tasted like a frozen meal from the grocers freezer with authentic marinara sauce on top and mozzarella cheese. A frozen meal from the grocers freezer. The meal was only $10 on the menu plus the meatballs and delivery fee added up to a price too steep - when you're just craving authentic Ma & Pa Italian cuisine. I hate to say it, but I've had better at the commercial chain OLIVE GARDEN and they don't claim to be authentic at all.

We used to love floridinos but our visit today put a bad taste in our mouth. I wanted a light lunch so I chose a bowl of their Italian wedding soup. I was incredibly surprised when I was brought a bowl the size of a thimble. When I inquired if this was a bowl the server mumbled something and walked away quickly. The soup itself was nothing to write home about the little pearl noodles were basically mush. Everyone else's food in my party was up to par with their normal standards but I was put off by the size of my my meal. At the end we inquired again if this was really a bowl and the server got a little snippy and said "yes! I'll show you a cup for the size!" He proceeded to bring out an even smaller thimble and show us that indeed we had been given a "bowl". For comparison, the "bowl" I was given was the size of a normal soup cup that one would receive at a normal restaurant.  All in all everyone else's meal was delicious and of normal size but their soup size choices were extremely misleading and I would caution anyone to order their soup.

It's been a while since I've reviewed Floridino's and I have been here a lot of times since my last review. Bottom line, they never have messed up my order. The food is always great and cooked/seasoned very well. The baked spaghetti is my favorite pasta dish. I always get either meatballs or a side of spicy Italian sausage with that order. The buffalo chicken pizza muffins with bacon are my favorite appetizer although you can't go wrong with the amazing original variety. Other favorites that are top notch and melt in your mouth good are: baked lasagna with a side of meatballs and/or sausage, fettuccine Alfredo, calzone, chicken Parmigiana, baked ziti and baked manicotti.
Pizza Muffins are awesome, but Pizza is more like Pappa Johns. I prefer an authentic NY Pizza with crispy crust.

Had lunch today 4/29/15 at floridino's and ordered large antipasto and a medium pizza with mushrooms and sausage. This place was a real find in Chandler Az. The antipasto salad was fresh and full of flavor. Very large portions and we had to take some home. The pizza was a surprise as well.... great sauce and delicious crust. The service was excellent and engaging. Friendly folks with plenty of room. To avoid the crowd a late afternoon lunch or early dinner is a perfect time. We will be regulars.
Excellent informal Italian.  Service great headed by Mike, the manager.  Everyone friendly.  Easy location.  Fast when on the go.  Lunch specials affordable especially with large families on budget.

This location is the worst. There was only one staff member there and he was an older gray haired man. I got his attention to send an order of muffins back because there was a hair in my food and he argued with me for 5 minutes trying to convince me it was a pice of cheese when it was very obvious it was a looooonnnggg black and gray hair. Service was very slow and un bussed tables everywhere. Also had to keep asking to get a refill of water.. Wont be back! I recommend the one in Chandler.

I am beside myself right now.  My server was incredible but cleary intimidated by the owner...in fact fearful of this rotten human. I have been a small business owner for decades..I get that their can be issues... Cockroaches dancing on my chicken, salad, bread and wine?  Is that cool with you?  Not with me, however, I understand it can happen in a food establishment. Owner came out after being requested of three times, I just wanted him to get the giant bug off my table as my purse was on table and I didn't want it to crawl in..Finally he comes out and.watches the flying sewer roach walk across all my food (i was sitting outside) after watching him for about 2 minutes...grabs the bug out of my wine, places him on his arm and says "this bothers you?" Allows the huge roach to climb all over him.  (DISGUSTING)  " Why yes it does...my plan was to take my leftovers to work tomorrow."  He says "And now, you are not going to take the leftovers?"  "No, that bug crawled all through my food." He let's the bug fly free in the wind with a brush of his hand and walks right back into the kitchen. server brings my bill and says the owner was nice enough take the meal off.  okay BRAVFRICKINO!!!!!!!!!!  but replaces it for a bill for the wine.  He told the server to tell me that I drank more of the wine than the roach did.  I told the adorable server who was so embarrassed, I was not going to pay the bill..She explained that she would be fired if I did not.  Just like she told me when I asked her originally to get the owner/manager when the bug was on my food.. I paid the bill and tipped her handsomely and told her she needs to find another job as she is very good at what she does.  My experience was horrible, but the way the server reacted was more than concerning...Kind of like how a battered woman would react. Btw...this occured two weeks ago...has taken me this long to make sense of what to write...stunning, and obviously this dude has a screw loose.  Andddd after posting this all over facebook and telling every single one of my clients, and will continue too...One of my clients/friends contacted the original Floridino's...The owner there was embarrassed for this man's actions and offered to make it right..Now that is customer service...These two businesses are not at all affiliated.  Do not go to this resturaunt...Many people left after witnessing his condescending nature..I was left furious for the evening...Try the Floridino's on Alma School...I've heard they are very very very good...and I already know the practice excellent customer service.

I highly recommend trying the pizza muffins (both the original and the pepperoni). Unfortunately, our experience was overshadowed by EXTREMELY poor service. And on the night we had out of town guests? We won't be back...
We have been here 3 times now and it has always been a good experience. The pizza biscuits are a great starter and the service has always been great for us.

Came in during Valentine's Day had great service from all the employees food was exactly how I like it and done just on time even though it was a busy day. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the mood for great food!

The pizza muffins and caesar salad were both really good! The pizza was pretty good, too, but nothing amazing IMO. My only complaint is that the service could have been better. It was okay, but I felt kind of ignored in favor of the regulars. When I left, none of the many employees standing around said bye or even smiled, which I found odd. So don't go here expecting to feel very welcome, but at least you'll get pretty good food! I'll probably be back at some point, but maybe I'll get it to go.

This place is awesome, I would absolutely return.  The environment overall was OK. Nothing stood out but it was good enough to have a good eating experience.  The pepperoni roll/muffin/whatever appetizer was delicious. It was not quite as good as the similar offering from Old Chicago, but it was still great. They had great deals on beer, which they served in a mini-pitcher. Wasn't even happy hour and I felt like the price was great.  The table all enjoyed their food. I ended up ordering a pasta dish that was absolutely delicious. I would return again for that alone.

Now this is the real deal of a local pizza joint with flavor.  Another review stated the calzone is not completely filled with stuffing at each corner, that is still true..a lot of wasted space and I don't care to eat simply cooked dough.  I too most likely will refrain from this menu item, but all else, well you cant go wrong and for my military buddies they have a military discount.  I'll be back...

Love this place - Pizza Muffins are the best....- updating my review 11-16-16 I have used their catering services many times - Just used them for my daughters wedding this past weekend.  Sarah and her staff were outstanding - they served Pizza Muffins for cocktail hour - received rave reviews for them - buffet line food was outstanding - they provided table service clean up efficiently and politely. I received feedback from many, many attendees telling me how great the food and service was. Thank you Sarah and the Floridino's team for helping make it a great night!

Popped in the other day.  My wife ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, and I got me a chicken caesar salad.  Where to begin?  Lets start with portion size.  We weren't looking for some hefty size portion, but if this was for a grown man, they would have laughed and said thanks for the sampler.  The meatballs were pretty small too, and probably came from a restaurant supply house.  The sauce tasted exactly like they opened up a can of crushed tomatoes and heated it up.  Very bland, no flavor or visible herbs/seasonings.  I'm not a gambler, but I would bet this was a purchased sauce... and being a family owned business, this was quite unexpected.  My salad came out quick... too quick.  My chicken wasn't hot.  It had been sitting around a while.  That made a big difference in taste.  In my opinion, Floridino's has a great chicken caesar salad... BUT only if you get fresh chicken.  Specifically ASK for fresh and hot chicken!  I will.  As we walked out, I noticed a boxing gym in the same strip mall area.  I gots ta check that out.
Great service! terrible food, a shame.  The Ceasar salad had the wrong type of lettuce, wrong dressing. Came with tomatos!  Lasagna bland and mushy!  And why. The Tv??!
First let me say, thank you for the friendly staff and managers . You guys were awesome. The food is awesome. Especially the cheesy bread sticks! Everything was great overall .

We have driven by here numerous times and always see a somewhat FULL Parking lot,, We decided to try this place out..   Figured 1. Get pizza, if they can do pizza right,, we come back.. Wife got Egg Plant Parmigiana..   Service Excellent, Wait time for food, Great, not too quick, but not too long.  The Food: Pizza was fresh, and the bottom had a light Crunch which i like.. I often put pizza on a frying pan to get that crunch with left overs.. Not the best pizza by far, but in the top 5 i would say for Chandler..  Egg Plant Parmigiana, Wife loved it, and has ideas on making her own version... Egg Plant isn't really one of my choice plates, so i wont say yay or nay..  Prices were a little high, close to what you would pay at Olive Garden, Red Lobster (not that i go there), or similar places.. for the variety, i will come back, but if i just want pizza, the budget will decide, and for these prices, i will easily go to NELLO's instead..  Great restaurant,... I would recommend but be specific on the expectations.

Always great food. Unique offerings w their pizza rolls and calzones. Their baked dishes are sometimes large enough to share.  The one thing we aren't fond of is their garlic bread. It looks like pizza dough flattened out and baked but it's so flippin' dry and lacking of garlic and butter that they try to put in it. They need to make something better. I know they can because of their pizza rolls and other doughy offerings.  Overall it is a great neighborhood eatery that has awesome food , quick service and a Mom and Pop feel. Come as you are!!

Comfort food at some of its best. Portions are huge for the price you're paying, and the calzones are absolutely monstrous. If you can actually eat a whole calzone by yourself, you're a hungrier man than I.  There isn't a whole lot of seating, so consider takeout if you're in a hurry to eat or need to feed a particularly large group.

My boyfriend and I got the special to go the other night. The wait was reasonable especially because the dining room was pretty full. The special came with a tossed salad that I was slightly dissapointed with because it was just a box of iceburg lettuce with what resembled tomatoes cubes,  but its ok I came for the pizza.  The special also included cheesy bread sticks which weren't bad, but nothing to write home about and the sauce that came on the side was meh. But that's ok because I came for the pizza... Now the pizza was surprisingly tastey. Awesome thin crust and the toppings were plentiful. I would definitely come back for the pizza but probably leave out the extras. Side note.... I was pretty disappointed they didn't have wings, probably take away a star for that.

We eat lunch here at least once a week. This place is always crazy busy and that's because everything is delish! Take a friend and split a deluxe calzone and a spicy chicken salad. Everyone raves about pizza muffins and they are great too. I don't know anyone who has had anything they didn't like. Prices are really reasonable too.
Great family pizza joint.  Liked the ambiance, fun and welcoming.  Had lunch...Food was above average.  Will definitely come back for dinner some time.

Two words: huge calzones. Okay one more word: cheap! This place is good quality neighborhood Italian food.  I have heard the lunch specials are great too. I did try the pizza rolls - they're awesome but definitely not the healthiest.  Its been busy every time I've stopped in to pick up my order. Have never dined in. According to other reviews the bar is friendly.
Very good little Italian place!  We are from out of town and this was a nice little gem. The pizza muffins are awesome. Just order 12 instead of doing 6 and then getting 6 more like we did!

My wife and I have been a couple times now and we always leave wanting to come back sooner rather than later. The pizza muffins are as good as advertised, you'll be tempted to order 6, but 12 is the better option, always. We really enjoy the atmosphere, which is friendly and feels like a family run, welcome to our home feeling. We brought our 7 month daughter and staff seemed happy to accommodate our needs. I went with the chicken Parmesan sandwich which was tasty, the bun was light and crispy. Hopefully we don't forget to visit again before too much time passes.
First time here to benefit Wildhorse Horse Ranch!  Great food and service. You have to try the "muffins"!

Giving it a 4 stars cuz I fell in love with the pizza muffins.  Yeah I said it  I love these things that remind me of a really good cinnamon roll  only made with pizza dough and toppings.  Yummy..    Our waiter was very nice and our food was delivered in a timely manner.  The salads looked good, didn't order one and it's a good thing.  I was stuffed after eating half of my calzone.  Yeah they are pretty big.    Hubby got the ziti with meatball and he really liked it.  Better then our other favorite place that's just up the street from here.    My calzone had a lot of mozzarella cheese but very little ricotta but the fresh tomato and spinach made up for that.  The red sauce wasn't the most spectacular I ever eaten.  Next time I might try it inside my calzone and see how I like.
The food was amazing!!! Our server, Angie, was also such a treat!! The food was  so reasonably priced and I will definitely come here again!!
It is one of my favourite pizza places. I like their white calzone. One of my many Saturday rituals. They get really busy sometimes due to special offers for seniors and other such occasions.

Good food- okay service ( depending on server)- great portions ( except lunch menu).   I have introduced some friends to this little eatery and they have all loved the :  -pizza muffins -calzones -lasagna  those are definitely the best as the other dishes are just okay. All in all- for the reasonable prices and great tasting italtion foods...it worth the calories and the savory bites!
Great place .  Our favorite Italian restaurant since moving to Chandler in 2002.  GREAT service, wonderful food, huge portions - everything's good - especially after they expanded their floor space.

I usually get the food here takeout, and have only eaten in once.  The pizza is very good, and better than what you'd get form a delivery place.  The calzones are gigantic, and well worth the calories. The white pizza is one of my favorites, but don't sleep on the red sauce pies either. The pepperoni is great, tho every once in a while it has a bit too much sauce.

Came here for a work lunch. It was decent. The lunch was affordable and the staff was friendly. I had the lunch calzone special. It tasted ok, but I got very little filling. I had ground beef and onions, but the majority of it was just a cheese filled bread pocket. I should definitely come back and try something else, but I was a little underwhelmed by the calzone.

Ok...so we all know (or at least I do...) that the Floridino's on Alma School is really really good. Not only is it good, but it's cheap!    The BF and I decided to try the new location and to our surprise it is not really the same restaurant. I think it has different owners (?), the menu is different, the prices are higher, the food is not as good, and the service is lacking to say the least. I was SO disappointed. The restaurant itself is a lot colder feeling than the original, with weird lighting and is strangely quiet (the place wasn't empty, but it didn't have that bustling with business feel or sounds like the original has). Our waitress did not smile and seemed genuinely angry when we needed a minute to decide on food and when we told her we were sharing. Not real cool. We shared a salad, breadsticks, and a calzone. The salad was fine (but the dressing tasted slightly off from the other restaurant), the breadsticks are totally different....like thicker and hard.... the calzone was bigger, but the dough used was not as tasty as the dough at the original location. I still gave the place 3 stars because the food was decent, but, needless to say, I would never choose this location over the original.    PS: The BF asked me if it was fair to compare this location to the original (because, honestly, if there was not an original and better version I probably would have given this place a 4) BUT I do think it's fair because even if it is different owners, they are using the same name and so, in my opinion, they should have consistency in their menu, prices, and service..... Just sayin.....

The BF and I went here tonight and it was AWESOME!!! This place is a cute little family restaurant that has comforting food for extremely inexpensive. We shared an individual salad, which was fresh and had an abundance of cucumbers and tomatoes...also, the house italian dressing was very tasty. We got an order of breadsticks, which were good, nothing wonderful, but something I would get again. Then we shared a calzone with pepperoni and ricotta cheese that was very good. The calzone crust was golden and delicious and the sauce was also very good. But you wanna know the best part? Our very filling dinner cost 12$. That's right. 12$. That is crazy ridiculous! We will definitely be back here... this may be our new go to pizza place, so hooray for that!

Our family absolutely loves this place! Their food is so good, and their prices are amazing. If you go, you've got to try the pizza muffins, the pazzo salad bowls, and the butternut squash ravioli is amazing. When I'm there I also buy a big tub of their ranch dressing that they make there, it's so yummy.

Good Italian.   great fresh pizza sauce and dough! me and the wife order the sauce and the dough by itself on occasion cause it's so good and only 3 bucks! then we add our favorite quality ingredients. we love it here, and visit occasionally.  The good things that Floridinos does is that they have some good fresh food: bread, pizza, sauces, pasta  Some not so fresh things we stay away from seems to be the chicken in any form, it tastes good, it's edible, just not fresh. Have not tried it all the food but you'll figure out your likings if you go here regularly. You notice that a lot of things are just heated up in the oven when ordered making food a bit soggy and pasta a bit dry and crunchy  The customer service here is awesome! Smart people, nice, quick, you name it. Service is great.  To go orders ate great here to. I love getting orders to go all the time

Had another Great Quick meal here. The calazone with mushrooms' olives & ricotta Cheese. Delicious! As luck would have it they were also televising the EPL Arsenal Vs. Tottenham Hotspur match. I lingered here alittle while longer to watch. While enjoying the game, I had a few good blonde ales from a great local brewery and really enjoyed my calazone. This is a nice little local place to eat great food on the go and enjoy a few surprises as well. Cheers!

Cody the waiter is worth the price of admission.  He was so different from last night's waiter (at the Blue Adobe) it was ridiculous.  He's got a very good attitude and a cheerful, funny patter.  I'd ask for him.  The Pizza muffin was very good, the meatball sub outstanding, and that sundae with the brownie was obscene.  Bread pudding pretty dang good if you like that kind of thing. You don't need all of the things you think you need, but you won't regret it.  Got right in and the place cleared out at 7:30pm on a Tuesday.

Service was great all around. Drinks and food were pretty low in price. But the food was bland / just okay - we had the butternut squash ravioli and chicken parmesan. The "spicy" pink sauce that was on the ravioli was not spicy at all, it just tasted like alfredo with maybe a little marinara sauce mixed in. The marinara on the chicken parm and accompanying ziti was just plain marinara, practically flavorless.  The original pizza muffins were, however, very tasty.   I can see the appeal for large families looking to take their family out for dinner without breaking the bank. But if I have absolutely no desire to eat leftovers, I'm not likely to return.

Excellent Sr Citizen deal on mondays after 3!! Get there early, but worth the wait. Staff is always pleasant and friendly. We come at least twice a month and have never had a bad or even so-so meal. Their monthly specials are worth trying...yum!! The baked spaghetti is excellent

Q: How did the hipster burn his mouth? A: He took a bite of his pizza before it was cool!  Yeah, I went there.  I also went to Floridino's which has been around since 1996!  And once you walk inside, the carpet squares, the dark green lighting sconces and wall paint, and the dim lighting will prove that clearly.  It's a bit dated but it's quaint!  Business had a constant steady flow, every table was taken, and the staff was fast and efficient.  So since it was our first time going even though my homie Linh L. has been harassing me to go, I wanted to try a little bit of everything.  Here's what we got:  * ORIGINAL STYLE MUFFINS [Stuffed with ham, ground beef, Italian sausage and fresh mozzarella cheese], 1/2 Dozen for $4.99: - Yum!  That fatty sausage made each bite so decadent and juicy and I love that mozzarella cheese.  Te ham and ground beef just makes every bite all the more flavorful.  * PEPPERONI MUFFINS, 1/2 Dozen for $4.99: - When is pepperoni ever a bad thing?  Get these.  I think I might even like them more than the Original Style Muffins.  Then again, I am a pizza fiend.  * BUTTERNUT SQUASH RAVIOLI [Half moon shaped pasta filled with a fresh blend of roasted butternut squash, ricotta and Parmesan cheese. Tossed in our Spicy "Pink" sauce], $12.59: - Holy moley, that's a lot of sauce!  As soon as the waitress set the plate down, a waterfall of spicy pink sauce splashed onto the table.  All good.  I was a bit curious though as to why I got square ravioli instead of moon shaped ones but no biggie.  I still ate every single one of those butternut squash filled pillows.  It was deliciously sweet!  I also enjoyed the slight heat from the dish.  Spicy sweet?  Yes please!  Presentation isn't cute but oh well.  * SPECIAL CALZONE [Pepperoni, ham, onion, green pepper and mushroom], $10.49: - I didn't even get around to trying this.  The onion looked raw though so I was a bit put off by that but it was a generous portion and smelled amazing.  All in all, I'd definitely come back to Floridino's for their delicious muffins.  I want to try all the flavors!

So we went to Floridino's because I read somewhere that they were rated the best Italian restaurant in Chandler.  I try not to expect too much when I go to a restaurant like this because it is subjective.  My wife and I went for date night.  We ordered a lot for 2 people with intentions of taking some home for leftovers for the week.    I have to say that Floridino's isn't over hyped.  The food was excellent and the service was better.  They had a floater that seemed his only job was to get people refills on their drinks, this is a nice touch!    If you are thinking about going, don't be a dope like I was and put it off.  Reward yourself!

This place is packed every night! Get there early and hope you can get a seat because you'll be in for a treat!  One of the best pizza's i've ever had in my life.  The flavor and taste of the bread was amazing.  Their sauces were very good along with their toppings.  Looking forward to coming back and trying more of their dishes.  K
This place is AWESOME Great prices plus the pizza muffins are to dine for!  I have been coming here for years.  Expect a wait if you come on weekends since the place does get packed!

You cannot find a calzone like theirs anywhere! Trust me, I've tried. I live in California now and often crave this place and can't have it. So I settle on other place and it turns out... I do not like calzones unless it's from floridinos. So now I just go when I visit chandler. Would love if some of my friends could ship me one!

I absolutely love Floridino's. The pizza is always on point and a calzone will change your life! They are always super friendly. You can tell a lot of love goes into everything. We order from there nearly every weekend. Especially during football season.
you cannot beat Floridino's for value for the dollar.  Awesome food and great service.

I have eaten at Floridino's Gilbert for many years. The food is excellent and the  service great. The pizza crust is soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Dema the owner is charming and inviting to everyone. I came here at least 1 per week when my daughter was younger because the kids love it and the prices for kids pizza is great. Love his pizza and place.

First and last time I'll go to flordinos. I'm not sure how this place has 4 stars unless they are fake reviews. I ordered a large pizza half pepperoni half pineapple and a order if the "famous bread sticks". First, the order was messed up and they put pepperoni on the whole pizza, which I can get past, mistakes happen. However, the food quality was absolute garbage. The pizza tasted like gas station pizza, and im not  talking about the good QT pizza. I'm talking about pizza at AMPM that has been sitting under the heat light for three days. The famous bread sticks we're bland and didn't have a whole lot of flavor. Overall just disappointing.
Excellent. Service was great and fast on a busy Friday night. Zesty bread sticks, calzones, pizza...all very good

I heard great things about this restaurant but after reading the reviews it sounds like the other location is the place to be.   I went to this location with some co-workers at lunch time. There wasn't much business, so we thought it should fairly easy. The server messed up our food, bringing the wrong dish out to someone, and I became suspicious when the chicken parm was ready only minutes later after taking it back to the kitchen. I had ordered the lobster ravioli and found that whatever they stuffed the ravioli with was not good lobster, or was mixed with something that did not compliment the lobster. The inside was very spongy and I suspect these were actually frozen ravioli's instead of fresh made. The ravioli's themselves were also overcooked and mushy and drowning in a plate of sauce. I was also not expecting to pay $17.99 for lobster ravioli, not to mention my bill came to over $20 with my iced tea. I will say out cheesy garlic bread that comes with the meal was good.   I would probably not come back to this location however, I would be willing to try the location in Chandler.

I was there thus at 1215 no one there sign said lunch special 7.99 food was bad then waitress charged 8.99 for special she couldn't figure out why cook came out he couldn't figure it out  after 15 mins I left 20.00 and said I have to go the bill should have been 1.00 they have clue whoever the waitress is is bad the meatball sandwich is better at subway and the pasta was terrible this place is not Italian I will never go back.  sorry but anyone who thinks this is Italian doesn't know Italian

Great family Italian joint. We got really great service and I was really impressed with the level of food. I had the chicken and we also had a spaghetti and meat balls at the table and a pizza. They do get really crowded and there is often a line to get in. Best to make sure you plan an extra 20 to 30 minutes of wait time when you get there.
Fantastic food, good service, at a great price.  Highly recommend eating here.  Only thing--they don't seem to take reservations, so plan accordingly!

I forgive their crowdedness always because it's so good.   Last night my child's school had a fundraiser there (read: damn good excuse to go back) and since it's less than a mile from her school, we rocked it after I picked her up. Pizza muffins are always the thing ordered no matter the group, and I love that they have at least one local San Tan Brewery beer on tap mostly always, and it was only $2 a pint!   When I go, I always get the Calzone. The two item calzone is how I roll and I am a traditional ricotta kinda guy; they sure do load it up, so I always order that. If we have 2+ people we like to also get the antipasto salad, which is always made fresh and tasty with ingredients that seem to be picked daily.   Tonight my daughter had the ravioli from the full children's menu and her mother said it was quite tasty, too. Unless you have a large party for the party room, there's usually a well worth it wait, but last night we noticed they're remodeling so I bet they're adding more seating through a previously sealed off area. Go team!

I came in for a rehearsal dinner and I loved the party set up, it was away from the other restaurant goers so it felt intimate (even a private bathroom!) The real star of the meal was the pizza muffins. I could live off the things. Super good!

Love this place - after visiting England, my sister and I come in here and, despite the Italian food, see this place like we do a good English pub. (Pubs are not necessarily bars, like they world be here in the US). We come here and love it - all the food is fresh, real, and light - nothing here is heavy or fake tasting. I love their calzones because the the bread is so  light and fluffy! Mmm. Also, their fettuccini alfredo is amazing!

My girlfriend and I were warmly welcomed by our server and every aspect was great until I ordered a cocktail. The cocktail was supposed to contain 2 Oz of white rum and 1 Oz of hpnotiq with sprite as a mixer. Served in an 8 Oz glass, I literally  couldn't taste the liquor and there was maybe 1/4 Oz of hpnotiq. No big deal, I let the server know that the drink was incorrectly made, she offered a new drink but I decided against it. When the check was dropped I noticed the $7 drink charge was not taken off. I work in the industry, I very rarely make a complaint but I let her know that I felt I shouldn't be charged for the cocktail. A few moments later I am aggressively approached by a man who was apparently the owner. Before I could even get a word in he began to go on a rant about how wrong I was, how he ran the place flawlessly, and eventually started raising his voice towards me. I was so thrown off about how aggressive, egotistical and arrogant that this so called owner was that I could hardly respond. After arguing with him (I maintained a professional tone and polite word choice) this guy just gets more and more aggressive. He eventually only gave me half off my drink that he horribly poured with his own two hands that are apparently incapable of making mistakes. Absolutely the most unprofessional, unpleasant, arrogant owner/manager I have ever encountered. The food was good, our service was flawless. We'll never be back because of this man, who by the way never introduced himself.  P.S. the owner had no idea what white rum was. Yep, the same owner who apparently knows how to make a flawless cocktail. This guy pulled out a bottle of Malibu because it's rum with a white label, I stopped him and pointed out the correct bottle. What a joke.

Crust is delicious.  Not thin but not think, right amount of sauce, cheese and toppings. The original pizza muffins are addicting.  I have had a couple of pasta dishes, and they are good.  But I drive the 15 miles for the pizza, muffins and a fair price.
